monster.name: Cacophonous Chimera

trait.name: Cacophonous Chorus
entries: The cacophonous chimera creates a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of noise. A creature that starts its turn in the emanation that can hear it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) thunder damage.

trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
entries: The cacophonous chimera has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks that rely on sight or smell.

reaction.name: Crescendo of Chaos (1/Day)
entries: {@actTrigger} The cacophonous chimera becomes bloodied. It can take this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} even if it has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition or is otherwise unable to take reactions. {@actResponse} All conditions and spells on the cacophonous chimera immediately end unless it chooses to be affected by them, and it can move up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and ignoring difficult terrain. It then unleashes a blast of thunderous power. Creatures within 300 feet of it who can hear it must make a Wisdom saving throw {@dc 17}. {@actSaveFail} 17 ({@damage 5d6}) thunder damage plus 17 ({@damage 5d6}) psychic damage, and the target falls {@condition prone} and can’t stand until the end of its next turn.

legendaryHeader: The cacophonous chimera always takes its turn on initiative count 20. On its turn, it can use its movement and interaction as normal, but it does not take an action or bonus action unless forced to by a spell or other effect. Instead, it takes one of the following Legendary Actions at the end of each player character's turn.

legendary.name: Claws and Talons
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 11}, reach 10 ft. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) slashing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it is knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Contaminated Bite (1/Round)
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 11}, reach 10 ft. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. Constitution saving throw {@dc 17}. {@actSaveFail} The target gains a Contamination level.

legendary.name: Lamprey Tail
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 11}, reach 30 ft. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) piercing damage, and the target has the Bleeding condition ({@dice 2d4}).

legendary.name: Aerial Maneuver (1/Round)
entries: The cacophonous chimera flies up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Cacophony (1/Round)
entries: The chimera’s three heads sing a discordant song. The effect varies based on which head is taking the lead. Each time it uses this Legendary Action, it can’t use the same effect it chose last round.

items.name: Bewildering Chitter (Ratling)
entries: Intelligence saving throw {@dc 17}, each creature in a 300-foot emanation that can hear it. {@actSaveFail} 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage, and the target is Bewildered (save ends).

items.name: Chilling Howl (Garmyr)
entries: Wisdom saving throw {@dc 17}, each creature in a 300-foot emanation that can hear it. {@actSaveFail} 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage, and the target is Immobilized (save ends).

items.name: Staggering Screech (Harpy)
entries: Charisma saving throw {@dc 17}, each creature in a 300-foot emanation that can hear it. {@actSaveFail} 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage, and the target is Staggered (save ends).

legendary.name: Wing Blast
entries: Strength saving throw {@dc 17}, each creature within 15 feet. {@actSaveFail} 13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) thunder damage, and the target is pushed 10 feet away. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The cacophonous chimera chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting it and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11 or higher, the effect ends. It can use this Legendary Action even if it would otherwise be unable to act, is controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its statistics.

monster.name: Gravekeeper

trait.name: Dazzling Aura
entries: The gravekeeper sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius. A creature that starts its turn in the bright light takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage.

legendaryHeader: The gravekeeper always takes its turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On its turn, the gravekeeper can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or bonus action on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the gravekeeper takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn.

legendary.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 9}, reach 10 ft. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Lantern Blast
entries: Magical octarine beams flash from one of the gravekeeper's many lanterns at one creature it can see within 120 feet that is not behind total cover, subjecting it to one of the following effects (the gravekeeper can only use each blast once per round):

items.name: 1. Dispelling Blast
entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 18}. {@actSaveFail} 35 ({@damage 10d6}) psychic damage. Any spell or magical effect on the target ends, and it has the Bewildered condition (save ends). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

items.name: 2. Forceful Blast
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 18}. {@actSaveFail} 35 ({@damage 10d6}) force damage, and the target is pushed 20 feet away from the gravekeeper and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

items.name: 3. Blinding Blast
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 18}. {@actSaveFail} 35 ({@damage 10d6}) radiant damage, and the target has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition (save ends). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

items.name: 4. Contaminating Blast
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 18}. {@actSaveFail} 35 ({@damage 10d6}) necrotic damage, and the target gains one Contamination level. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

items.name: 5. Igniting Blast
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 18}. {@actSaveFail} 35 ({@damage 10d6}) fire damage, and the target has the {@hazard Burning|XPHB} condition ({@dice 10d6} fire). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

items.name: 6. Freezing Blast
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 18}. {@actSaveFail} 35 ({@damage 10d6}) cold damage, and the target has the Frozen condition ({@dc 18}). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

legendary.name: Glide (1/Round)
entries: The gravekeeper moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Sludge Column {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 18}, each creature in a 10-foot-radius, 60-foot-tall cylinder, centered on a point within 120 feet of the gravekeeper. {@actSaveFail} 42 ({@damage 12d6}) necrotic damage, and the target gains one Contamination level. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

legendary.name: Animate Walls {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 18}, each creature within 10 feet of any number of walls within 120 feet of the gravekeeper. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 18}). The wall sprouts limbs to facilitate this grapple, which disappear when the condition ends.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The gravekeeper chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting it and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11 or higher, the effect ends on it. The gravekeeper can use this Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

monster.name: Living City

trait.name: Digestive Aura
entries: A creature that starts its turn in the living city's space takes 10 ({@damage 4d4}) acid damage. At the start of its turn, the living city decides whether its Digestive Aura is active until the start of its next turn (no action required).

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the living city remains motionless in its Structural Form, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary structure or vehicle, such as a house or a sailing ship.

trait.name: Structural Form
entries: The living city can spend 10 minutes in {@status Concentration|XPHB} to shape-shift into a Gargantuan structure or back into its true, amorphous form. Its game statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. While in the form of a structure, the living city takes up its entire space and creates floors, walls, doorways, and windows within its space which resemble and behave like normal structures, while leaving behind open space within it to create rooms. Creatures can pass through the open spaces and stop there as if moving through a normal structure. The walls and floors of the living city can be damaged and thus breached. Each 5-foot-by-5-foot section has AC 15 and 30 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Reducing a section to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} destroys it and deals 30 damage to the living city. A living city can only take this damage once per turn. In addition, the living city extrudes pieces of itself inside its space which resemble furnishings and everyday objects. The extrusions appear, feel, sound, and behave exactly like the mimicked objects. A thin, slimy tendril connects any furnishings or objects to the body of the living city. The tendril has AC 15 and 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}. If the tether is severed or destroyed, the simulacra melts into goo, but does no harm to the living city.

trait.name: No Exit
entries: When it rolls for initiative, the living city reflexively closes the windows, doors, and other egress points on the outside of its body, preventing creatures inside it from leaving its space. A creature in the living city's space that attempts to leave its space using teleportation or planar travel is subjected to the following effect: Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} {@dc 20}. {@actSaveFail} 27 ({@damage 5d10}) psychic damage. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The teleportation or planar travel fails.

legendaryHeader: The living city always takes its turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On its turn, the living city can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or bonus action on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the living city takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 10}, reach 0 ft. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

legendary.name: Grasping Tendril
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 10}, reach 10 ft. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is pushed or pulled 10 feet (the living city's choice).

legendary.name: Haunting Whispers
entries: Intelligence {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} {@dc 15}, one creature in the living city's space. {@actSaveFail} 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition (save ends).

legendary.name: Shifting Form
entries: The living city alters the composition of a 10-foot-by-10-foot area inside it, creating walls, doors, windows, stairs, or furnishings. It can choose to make the area difficult terrain. Creatures inside the living city who are not directly observing the shift must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) check to notice the change. If the living city creates a wall that cuts through another creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (the living city's choice). If a creature would be surrounded on all sides by the wall (or the wall and another solid surface), that creature can make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a success, it can use its reaction to move up to its speed so that it is no longer enclosed by the wall.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The living city chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting it and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11 or higher, the effect ends on it. The living city can use this Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

monster.name: The World Ender

trait.name: Delerium Storm Aura
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 120 feet of the World Ender takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) lightning damage and is subjected to the following effect: Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} {@dc 24}. {@actSaveFail} The target gains one Contamination level.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The World Ender is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Mutations Abound
entries: A creature that gains a Contamination level from the World Ender's Delerium Storm Aura must roll {@dice 2d6} and take the lower result to determine if they mutate. Whenever a creature within the aura gains a mutation, that creature must roll twice on the mutations table and gains both mutations.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the World Ender is destroyed, it regains all of its hit points in 1 hour unless a {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell is used to prevent it from rejuvenating. This is a stressful use of the {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The World Ender deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Unbound Arcana
entries: Whenever the World Ender is the target of a spell, an Arcane Anomaly is triggered on the caster.

legendary.name: Necrotic Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 19}, reach 15 ft. {@h}37 ({@damage 5d10 + 10}) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Bite (1/Round)
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 19}, reach 15 ft. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d10 + 10}) piercing damage, and if the target is a creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 27}). While {@condition grappled}, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition and the World Ender can't Bite another target.

legendary.name: Charge Eradication Beam {@recharge 5}
entries: Octarine energy ripples through the body of the World Ender from its tail up to its head. The World Ender's Eradication Beam recharges, and it chooses the direction it will face to unleash its Eradication Beam. The World Ender can only use this Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} if it's the first Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} it has taken this round. After using this Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, the World Ender can't use Bite, Bellowing Roar, or Devour until the start of the next round.

legendary.name: Eradication Beam (Special Recharge)
entries: The World Ender can only use this Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} if it's the last Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} it takes this round. Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} {@dc 27}, each creature and object in a 1000-foot-long, 20-foot-wide line. {@actSaveFail} 110 ({@damage 20d10}) force damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} A creature is disintegrated along with anything it is wearing or carrying if this damage leaves it with 0 hit points, and can't be revived except by a {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell. The Eradication Beam destroys any {@spell Wall of Force|XPHB}, {@spell Forcecage|XPHB}, or {@spell Prismatic Wall|XPHB} spell within its area. It also damages unattended magic items in its area, including artifacts.

legendary.name: Octarine Lightning Strike
entries: Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} {@dc 27}, each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within 500 feet. {@actSaveFail} 54 ({@damage 12d8}) lightning damage, and the target has the Shocked condition until the start of its next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

legendary.name: Bellowing Roar (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} {@dc 27}, each creature in a 120-foot emanation originating from the World Ender that can hear it. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Deafened|XPHB} condition (save ends). While {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

legendary.name: Ground Slam (1/Round)
entries: Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} {@dc 27}, each creature on the ground in a 30-foot cone. {@actSaveFail} 26 ({@damage 4d12}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is pushed 10 feet away from the World Ender and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The cone becomes difficult terrain until the start of the World Ender's next turn.

legendary.name: Devour
entries: The World Ender can't take this Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} if it has used its Bite Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} this round. The World Ender makes a Bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it has {@condition grappled}. If the attack hits, the target takes the Bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Restrained|XPHB} conditions, it has total cover against effects originating from outside the World Ender, and it takes 56 ({@damage 16d6}) acid damage and gains a Contamination level at the start of each of the World Ender's turns. If the World Ender takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the World Ender must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which land in unoccupied spaces within 10 feet of the World Ender with the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. If the World Ender dies, a swallowed creature no longer has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting with the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The World Ender chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting it and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11 or higher, the effect ends on it. The World Ender can use this Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

legendaryHeader: The World Ender always takes its turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On its turn, the World Ender can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or bonus action on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the World Ender takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn.

monster.name: Haze Regent Lenore von Kessel

trait.name: Haze Aura
entries: A creature starting its turn within 30 feet of Lenore is subjected to the following effect: {@actSave con} {@dc 19}. {@actSaveFail} The target gains a Contamination level. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Necrotic damage.

trait.name: Tendrils
entries: Lenore's long hair can latch onto surfaces to pull her in any direction. She has a {@variantrule Flying|XPHB} {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} of 40 feet (included in {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}) but cannot move more than 30 feet from a solid surface, including walls and ceilings.

legendary.name: Tentacle Hair
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 9}, reach 15 ft. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d4 + 4}) Piercing damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) Necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Contaminated Eye Blast
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 9}, range 120 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) Force damage, plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Necrotic damage, and if the target is a creature it is subjected to the following effect. {@actSave con} {@dc 19}. {@actSaveFail} The target gains one level of Contamination.

legendary.name: Grim Reveal (1/Round)
entries: Lenore removes her mask, revealing her horrific form. {@actSave wis} {@dc 19}, creatures within 60 feet of her who can see her. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition (save ends).

legendary.name: Octarine Wall (1/Day)
entries: Lenore summons a shimmering wall within 120 feet of her. The wall can be up to 90 feet long, 30 feet high, and 1 inch thick. Alternatively, she can shape the wall into a sphere up to 30 feet in diameter centered on a point she can see within range. The wall has three octarine layers. When a creature attempts to reach into or pass through the wall, it does so one layer at a time through all the wall's layers. {@actSave con} {@dc 19}. {@actSaveFail} h Layer 1: 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Necrotic damage and the target gains one level of Contamination and has the Dazed condition; h Layer 2: 17 ({@damage 5d6}) Necrotic damage, and the target gains two levels of Contamination and has the Defenseless condition; h Layer 3: 35 ({@damage 10d6}) Necrotic damage, and the target gains three levels of Contamination and the Helpless condition. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only. The wall can be destroyed by taking at least 100 Radiant or Force damage.

legendary.name: Radiant Gaze (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 19}, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} 44 ({@damage 8d10}) Radiant damage and the target gains one level of Contamination. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only. If Lenore sees her reflection within the {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}, she gains the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} conditions for {@dice 1d6} hours and can't take the Epic {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} for the duration.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: Lenore chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting her and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11 or higher, the effect ends on her. Lenore can use this Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} even if she would otherwise be unable to take actions, her actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters her game statistics.

legendaryHeader: Lenore always takes her turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On her turn, she can use her movement and interaction as normal. However, she does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on her turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, Lenore takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn.

monster.name: Pale Man

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (1/Round)
headerEntries: The Pale Man casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks):
At Will: {@spell Inflict Wounds|XPHB}, {@spell Mage Armor|XPHB} (included with AC), {@spell Magic Missile|XPHB}, {@spell Shield|XPHB}
2/Day Each: {@spell Bestow Curse|XPHB}, Black Tentacles, {@spell Hold Person|XPHB}, {@spell Web|XPHB}, {@spell Witch Bolt|XPHB}
1/Day Each: {@spell Antimagic Field|XPHB}, {@spell Blight|XPHB}, {@spell Chain Lightning|XPHB}, {@spell Giant Insect|XPHB}, {@spell Invisibility|XPHB}, {@spell Slow|XPHB}

trait.name: Insect Body
entries: The Pale Man can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the Pale Man can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect.

trait.name: Crawling Flesh
entries: When the Pale Man is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, he breaks apart into a swarm of contaminated insects in the same space. Unless the swarm is destroyed, the Pale Man's swarm returns to its cocoon and reforms into the Pale Man {@dice 1d6} days later.

trait.name: Aura of Fleshy Insects
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 18}, each creature of the Pale Man's choosing who starts its turn within 60 feet of the Pale Man. {@actSaveFail} 22 ({@damage 5d8}) Necrotic damage and the target gains one level of Contamination.

legendaryHeader: The cacophonous chimera always takes its turn on initiative count 20. On its turn, it can use its movement and interaction as normal, but it does not take an action or bonus action unless forced to by a spell or other effect. Instead, it takes one of the following Legendary Actions at the end of each player character's turn.

legendary.name: Contaminating Touch
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 10}, reach 10 ft. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) Necrotic damage, it is subjected to the following effect. {@actSave con} {@dc 18}. {@actSaveFail} The target gains one level of Contamination.

legendary.name: Forced Mutation
entries: The Pale Man targets a creature within 60 feet who has one or more mutations and magically alters the mutation. The Pale Man chooses one of the target's existing mutations to remove and replaces it with a different one of his choice.

legendary.name: Infest the Flesh (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 16}, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} from the Pale Man. {@actSaveFail} 22 ({@damage 5d8}) Necrotic damage, and the target gains the {@hazard Burning|XPHB} ({@dice 3d8} Necrotic) condition. A target also has the Dazed condition while it is burning in this way. Failure by 5 or more: The target also has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition (save ends) due to masses of swarming fleshy bugs. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

legendary.name: Contaminate (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 16}, each creature {@condition Restrained|XPHB} by the Pale Man's Infest the Flesh action. {@actSaveFail} The target gains one level of Contamination.

legendary.name: Abrupt Contaminant (1/Round)
entries: The Pale Man targets a creature within 60 feet who has one or more levels of Contamination. That creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Necrotic damage for each level of Contamination it has.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The Pale Man chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting him and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11 or higher, the effect ends on him. The Pale Man can use this Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, his actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters his game statistics.
Additional Spells If you have access to Dungeons of Drakkenheim or Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim, the Pale Man has the following spells added to his spellbook.
Dungeons of Drakkenheim:
At Will: Delerium Orb, Purge Contamination, Warp Bolt
2/Day Each: Conjure the Deep Haze, Delerium Blast, Forced Evolution
1/Day Each: Octarine Spray, Siphon Contamination Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim:
At Will: Bacterial Barrage, Caustic Grip, Infect
2/Day Each: Blood Worm, Septic Shock, Venomous Aura

monster.name: Rat Crown-Prince

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The Rat Crown-Prince has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Verminous Aura
entries: The Rat Crown-Prince emits a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of verminous contamination. A creature that starts its turn in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Necrotic damage.

legendaryHeader: The rat-crown prince always takes its turn on initiative count 20. On its turn, it can use its movement and interaction as normal, but it does not take an action or bonus action unless forced to by a spell or other effect. Instead, it takes one of the following Legendary Actions at the end of each player character's turn.

legendary.name: Contaminated Bite (1/Round)
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 10}, reach 5 ft. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d4 + 6}) Piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Necrotic damage. {@actSave con} {@dc 15}. {@actSaveFail} The target gains one Contamination level.

legendary.name: Delerium-Infused Blades
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 10}, reach 5 ft. or range 30/60 ft. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) Necrotic damage, and the target suffers one of the following effects of the Rat Crown-Prince's choice (he can't select the same option more than once per round):

items.name: Poison
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 16}. {@actSaveFail} 18 ({@damage 4d8}) Poison damage, and the target has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for 1 minute (save ends). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

items.name: Acid Burn
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 16}. {@actSaveFail} 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Acid damage, and the target has the {@hazard Burning|XPHB} condition ({@dice 3d6} Acid). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

items.name: Mindkiller
entries: If the target is maintaining {@status Concentration|XPHB} on a spell, it takes an extra 25 ({@damage 5d10}) Psychic damage unless it chooses to end its {@status Concentration|XPHB}.

legendary.name: Call Ratlings (1/Round)
entries: {@dice 2d4} Ratling Warriors appear, burrowing up from below unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of the Rat Crown-Prince. The warriors have 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} each and remain until killed.

legendary.name: Meld into Shadow (1/Round)
entries: The Rat Crown-Prince has the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition until he makes an attack.

legendary.name: Swift Stride
entries: The Rat Crown-Prince moves up to his {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The Rat Crown-Prince chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting him and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on him. The Rat Crown-Prince can use this action even if he would otherwise be unable to take actions, his actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters his game statistic.

trait.name: Aura of Hunger
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the Lord of the Feast takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Necrotic damage.

trait.name: Close-Quarters Hunter
entries: Being within 5 feet of a {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} creature doesn't impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the Lord of the Feast's ranged attack rolls.

trait.name: Hunter's Sense
entries: The Lord of the Feast has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against a {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} creature.

trait.name: Predatory Senses
entries: The Lord of the Feast has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks. He can pinpoint the position of any creature within 120 feet of him with the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Lord of the Feast regains 20 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} remaining.

The Lord of the Feast always takes his turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On its turn, the Lord of the Feast can use his movement and interaction as normal. However, he does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on his turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the Lord of the Feast takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

items.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 9}, reach 5 ft. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) Piercing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) Necrotic damage. {@actSave con} {@dc 17}. {@actSaveFail} The target gains one Contamination level.

items.name: Claws
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 9}, reach 10 ft. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) Slashing damage, and the target has the Bleeding condition ({@dice 4d4}).

items.name: Poison Arrow
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 9}, range 150/600 ft. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) Piercing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) Poison damage. {@actSave con} {@dc 17}. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition (save ends).

items.name: Ensnaring Arrow
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 9}, range 150/600 ft. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) Piercing damage, and the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition ({@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw ends).

items.name: Harpoon Arrow
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 9}, range 150/600 ft. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) Piercing damage, and if the target is Huge or smaller, it is pulled up to 20 feet toward the Lord of the Feast.

legendary.name: Reposition
entries: The Lord of the Feast moves up to his {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

legendary.name: Call of the Hunt (1/Round)
entries: The Lord of the Feast releases a blood-curdling howl that can be heard all across Drakkenheim. All garmyr in the city heed this call and rush towards the Lord of the Feast's current position. Each garmyr within 60 feet who can see and hear the Lord of the Feast can use its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} and make one melee or ranged attack with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The Lord of the Feast chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting him and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on him. The Lord of the Feast can use this action even if he would otherwise be unable to take actions, his actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters his game statistics.

monster.name: The Duchess

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The Duchess casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 20}):
At Will: {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB}
3/Day Each: {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB}, {@spell Dream|XPHB}, {@spell Polymorph|XPHB}, {@spell Sending|XPHB}
1/Day Each: {@spell Chain Lightning|XPHB}, {@spell Control Water|XPHB}, {@spell Hypnotic Pattern|XPHB}, {@spell Project Image|XPHB}, {@spell Scrying|XPHB}, {@spell Telekinesis|XPHB}

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The Duchess can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Aura of the Deep
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the Duchess takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Psychic damage.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
entries: As an action, a creature can touch one of the Duchess's Delerium shards to regain 10 ({@dice 3d6}) {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Once a Delerium shard restores {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} in this way, it can't do so again for 24 hours.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
entries: The Duchess is immune to Contamination and has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against contaminated spells. The Duchess may cast contaminated spells even though she does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Duchess has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Moisture Regeneration
entries: The Duchess regains 20 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of each of her turns if she is submerged at least partially in water. She dies only if she starts her turn at 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and does not regenerate.

reaction.name: Sacrificial Pawn
entries: {@actTrigger} The Duchess takes damage from an attack. {@actResponse} The Duchess chooses an ally or a creature {@condition Charmed|XPHB} by her to take the attack's damage instead.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 12}, reach 10 ft. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) Piercing damage.

legendary.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 12}, reach 20 ft. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) Bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 20}). The Duchess can have up to four creatures {@condition Grappled|XPHB} at a time. At the start of each of its turns until the grapple ends, the target is subjected to the following effect. {@actSave con} {@dc 17}. {@actSaveFail} The target gains one Contamination level.

legendary.name: Fling
entries: One Large or smaller object held or creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by the Duchess is thrown up to 60 feet in a direction of the Duchess's choice and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) Bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

legendary.name: Deep Domination (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 20}, one creature the Duchess can see. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition. The target is under the Duchess's control and can't take Reactions. The Duchess and the target can communicate telepathically over any distance. Whenever the target takes damage, it repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a failure, it gains one Contamination level. Once every 24 hours, if the creature is at least 1 mile away from the Duchess, it can repeat the saving throw. If the target undergoes a Monstrous Transformation, it becomes a Deep Dreg Warrior, a Deep Knight, or a Deep Siren, and is forever in thrall to the Duchess.

legendary.name: Call of the Deep (1/Round)
entries: The Duchess calls forth up to five Deep Dregs or one Deep Knight. The creatures appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of the Duchess and remain until destroyed. The creatures act after the Duchess on the same {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count and are under her control.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The Duchess chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting her and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on her. The Duchess can use this action even if she would otherwise be unable to take actions, her actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters her game statistics.

legendaryHeader: The Duchess always takes her turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On her turn, the Duchess can use her movement and interaction as normal. However, she does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on her turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the Duchess takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn

trait.name: Dimensional Anchor
entries: The Executioner can't be teleported or sent to another plane of existence unless it chooses to be.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The Executioner is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the Executioner is destroyed, it reforms with all of its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} 1 minute later unless a {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell is used to stop it. A {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell used in this manner is always stressful, and the caster must roll to determine whether or not they can cast the {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell ever again.

trait.name: Necrotic Vents
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the Executioner takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Necrotic damage.

trait.name: Stoic
entries: The Executioner can't take Reactions.

trait.name: Bound to Slaughter
entries: If the Executioner begins its turn more than 100 feet away from Slaughterstone Square, it disappears into the Haze and reappears 1 minute later at the center of Slaughterstone Square.

The Executioner always takes its turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On its turn, the Executioner can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the Executioner takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn

legendary.name: Lumber Forward (1/Round)
entries: The Executioner moves up to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

legendary.name: Death Grip
entries: Spectral chains appear around one creature within 300 feet of the Executioner. The target has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 15}), and it has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the grapple ends. The condition ends if the Executioner uses Death Grip against a different target.

legendary.name: Guillotine Blade (1/Round)
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 18}, reach 10 ft. or range 60 ft. {@h}45 ({@damage 10d6 + 10}) Slashing damage which ignores any {@spell Resistance|XPHB} or {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Slashing damage. Immediately after making a ranged attack, this weapon flies back to the Executioner's hands. Critical {@h}The target dies unless it has the Epic {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} action or Legendary {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} trait.

legendary.name: Destroyer (1/Round)
entries: The Executioner chooses a Huge or smaller object or structure within 5 feet of it. Alternatively, it can choose a spell or magical effect within 30 feet of it. The object or structure is destroyed, or the spell or effect ends.

legendary.name: Summon Grasping Shadows (1/Round)
entries: The Executioner targets {@dice 1d4} corpses within 300 feet of it. Each target's spirit rises as a Grasping Shadows in the nearest unoccupied space. The spirits act each round on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20, and disappear if the Executioner is destroyed.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The Executioner chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. The Executioner can use this action even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

trait.name: Protective Aura
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of Minazorond takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Lightning damage.

trait.name: Construct Resilience
entries: If damage reduces Minazorond to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 plus the damage taken, unless the damage is Radiant or from a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}. On a success, Minazorond drops to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead.

reaction.name: Draconic Rebuke
entries: {@actTrigger} Minazorond becomes {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}. It can use this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} even if it has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition or is otherwise unable to take Reactions. {@actResponse} All conditions and spells on Minazorond immediately end unless it chooses to be affected by them, and it can fly up to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking Opportunity Attacks and ignoring {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. Minazorond recharges and immediately uses its Terrifying Roar.

Minazorond always takes its turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On its turn, Minazorond can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, Minazorond takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

items.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 14}, reach 10 ft. {@h}33 ({@damage 4d12 + 7}) Piercing damage, and if the target is Medium or smaller, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 17}). While {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition.

items.name: Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 14}, reach 10 ft. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) Slashing damage.

legendary.name: Tail
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 22}, one creature Minazorond can see within 20 feet. {@actSaveFail} 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Force damage, and if the target is Medium or smaller, it has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

legendary.name: Shocking Burst
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 20}, one target Minazorond can see within 120 feet. {@actSaveFail} 22 ({@damage 4d10}) Lightning damage, and the target has the Shocked condition. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

legendary.name: Terrifying Roar (Recharges after a Short Rest)
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 20}, each creature in a 120-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from Minazorond that can hear it. {@actSaveFail} 18 ({@damage 4d8}) Thunder damage, and the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition (save ends).

legendary.name: Breathe Deep (1/Round)
entries: Minazorond's Breath Weapon recharges. Minazorond can only use this Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} if it's the first Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} it has taken this round.

legendary.name: Breath Weapon (Special Recharge)
entries: Minazorond uses one of the following breath weapons. It can only use this Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} if it's the last Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} it takes this round.

legendary.name: * Lightning Breath
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 22}, each creature in a 120-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} 81 ({@damage 16d8}) Lightning damage, and the target has the Shocked condition. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

legendary.name: * Thunder Breath
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 22}, each creature in a 120-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} 66 ({@damage 12d10}) Thunder damage, and the target is pushed 20 feet away from Minazorond and has the Dazed condition (save ends). Failure by 5 or More: Double damage, and the target also has the {@condition Deafened|XPHB} condition (save ends). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: Minazorond chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. Minazorond can use this action even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

trait.name: Aura of Storms
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the Crimson Countess takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Lightning damage.

trait.name: Pluck
entries: The Crimson Countess doesn't need to spend extra movement to drag a Medium or smaller creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by it.

The Crimson Countess always takes their turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On their turn, the Crimson Countess can use their movement and interaction as normal. However, they do not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on their turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the Crimson Countess takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

items.name: Grasping Talons
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 8}, reach 5 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) Piercing damage, and if the target is Medium or smaller, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 15}).

items.name: Lightning Javelin
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 8}, reach 5 ft. or range 30/60 ft. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) Lightning damage.

legendary.name: Aerial Acrobat
entries: The Crimson Countess flies up to her {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

legendary.name: Frightful Screech (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 15}, one creature within 120 feet of the Crimson Countess that can hear them. {@actSaveFail} 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition (save ends). While {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, the target must take the Dash action and move away from the Crimson Countess by the safest available route on each of its turns unless there is nowhere to move.

legendary.name: Lightning Strike {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 15}, each creature in a 60-foot long, 5-foot wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line}. {@actSaveFail} 36 ({@damage 8d8}) Lightning damage, and the target has the Shocked condition until the end of its next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The Crimson Countess chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on them. The Crimson Countess can use this action even if they would otherwise be unable to take actions, their actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters their game statistics.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
entries: The Think Tank is immune to contamination and has advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. It may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain contamination levels.

trait.name: Life Support System
entries: The Think Tank is protected by three machine nodes that make up its life support system. Each node is a Large object with AC 20, 25 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} per player character, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. The Think Tank can't move or be moved more than 60 feet away from any two of its nodes.

trait.name: Nightmare Aura
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 120 feet of the Think Tank takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage.

trait.name: Shield Generator
entries: As long as at least one machine node remains, the Think Tank's immunities can't be ignored except by effects caused by level 9 spells or artifacts. If all nodes are destroyed, the Think Tank loses its immunities.

trait.name: Telepathic Eavesdropping
entries: The Think Tank can project its consciousness to see and hear any creature or location within 5 miles as if it had cast {@spell Scrying|XPHB} (no action required). It can read thoughts, communicate telepathically, and listen in on telepathic communications.

action.name: Epic Actions
entries: The Think Tank always takes its turn on initiative count 20. On its turn it can move and interact normally, but instead of an action or bonus action, it takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn.

action.name: Contaminated Blast
entries: Melee or ranged attack roll: +12, reach 10 ft. or range 120 ft. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d12 + 6}) necrotic damage. Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} {@dc 20}. {@actSaveFail} The target gains a contamination level.

action.name: Telekinetic Grip
entries: Strength {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} {@dc 20}, one creature or object within 120 ft. Failure (creature): 28 ({@damage 8d6}) force damage, moved up to 30 feet, {@condition restrained}. Held creatures can repeat the save at the end of their turn. Objects up to 1,000 pounds not worn or carried are moved up to 30 feet.

action.name: Pluck the Puppet Strings
entries: Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} {@dc 20}, one creature within 120 ft. {@actSaveFail} 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage, and the target must use its reaction to move toward a creature of the Think Tank's choice and make a melee attack with advantage if in range.

action.name: Mind Cage (1/Round)
entries: Intelligence {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} {@dc 20}, one creature within 120 ft. {@actSaveFail} 33 ({@damage 6d10}) psychic damage, and the target perceives itself trapped in a nightmare until it escapes. While trapped: immobilized, {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}. The target may repeat the save each turn, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) psychic damage.

action.name: Unbind Gravity (1/Round)
entries: The Think Tank changes gravity in a 200-foot cube centered on itself until the end of the next round. All creatures and objects fall in the chosen direction unless anchored. Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} {@dc 20} to grab something. Alternatively, gravity may be negated, causing creatures and objects to float.

action.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The Think Tank chooses one effect currently on it and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11 or higher, the effect ends.

monster.name: Kingkiller Hydra (Epic)
languages: understands languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Corrosive Aura
entries: Area within 30 ft. is lightly obscured; creatures starting turn there take 20 ({@damage 8d4}) acid damage.

trait.name: Head Count
entries: Can't make more bite or spit acid attacks each round than it has heads.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: Hydra has five heads. Whenever it takes 25+ damage in a turn, one head dies. It dies if all heads die.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
entries: Gains extra reactions for opportunity attacks for each head beyond one.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: At least one head remains awake while it sleeps.

action.name: Epic Actions
entries: The hydra always acts on initiative 20 and takes one of the following at the end of each player's turn.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee attack roll: +14, reach 20 ft. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d8 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spit Acid
entries: Ranged attack roll: +14, range 150/600 ft. {@h}20 ({@damage 8d4}) acid damage, target burning ({@dice 8d4} acid). While burning, target is {@condition blinded}.

action.name: Grow Heads
entries: If a head died this round (not by fire), grow two heads and regain 20 HP.

action.name: Hydra Fury (1/Round)
entries: Makes one bite or spit acid attack for each head that hasn't attacked this round.

action.name: Trample (1/Round)
entries: Moves up to speed through Huge or smaller creatures. Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} {@dc 22}. {@actSaveFail} 35 ({@damage 10d6}) bludgeoning damage and {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tail (1/Round)
entries: Melee attack roll: +14, reach 15 ft. {@h}34 ({@damage 4d12 + 8}) bludgeoning damage, push 20 ft.

action.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The hydra chooses one effect on it and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On 11+, it ends.

trait.name: Writhing Aura
entries: The ground within 30 feet of the ravenous flora is filled with plant roots and becomes {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. A creature that starts its turn in the aura takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Poison damage.

trait.name: Poison Ivy
entries: If the ravenous flora would take Poison damage, it instead takes no damage and regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Poison damage it would have received.

The ravenous flora always takes its turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On its turn, the ravenous flora can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the ravenous flora takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

items.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 10 ft. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) Piercing damage, and the target has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition and the ravenous flora can't Bite another target.

items.name: Spit Acid
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 7}, range 150/600 ft. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) Acid damage, and the target has the {@hazard Burning|XPHB} condition ({@dice 2d4} Acid). While {@hazard Burning|XPHB}, the target has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition.

items.name: Swallow
entries: The ravenous flora makes one Bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it has {@condition Grappled|XPHB}. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed and the grapple ends. The swallowed target has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Restrained|XPHB} conditions, has {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} from attacks and effects outside the flora, and takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Acid damage at the start of each of its turns. The flora can have up to four targets swallowed at a time. If the flora takes 15 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which land with the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition in unoccupied spaces within 10 feet of it. If the flora dies, a swallowed creature no longer has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting with the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

legendary.name: Hypnotic Pollen (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 16}, each creature in a 60-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the ravenous flora. {@actSaveFail} 9 ({@damage 2d8}) Psychic damage, and the target has the Weakened condition (save ends). While Weakened, the target must spend all of its movement on each of its turns to move directly toward the ravenous flora. During this movement, the target ignores {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} caused by the flora's Writhing Aura.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The ravenous flora chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. The ravenous flora can use this action even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the troll remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a gigantic mushroom.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The troll regains 30 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of each of its turns. If the troll takes Acid or Fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Rotting Aura
entries: Any creature who starts its turn in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the troll takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Necrotic damage unless the troll has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

On its turn, the troll can move as normal. However, it does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the troll takes one of the following Epic Actions of its choice at the end of each player character's turn

legendary.name: Spore Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 10}, reach 10 ft. {@h}33 ({@damage 6d8 + 6}) Bludgeoning damage.

legendary.name: Grasping Tendrils
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 10}, reach 60 ft. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) Slashing damage, and if the target is Huge or smaller, the troll pulls the target up to 20 feet straight towards itself.

legendary.name: Entangling Mycelia (Recharge when Bloodied)
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 15}, each creature of the troll's choice in a 30-foot radius centered on it. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition (save ends).

legendary.name: Spawn Trolling (1/Round)
entries: The troll creates a Fungal Trolling which appears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of it. The fungal trolling acts immediately after the troll uses this action, then acts after the troll's turn on subsequent rounds.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The troll chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. A troll can use this action even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The striga has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on melee attack rolls against a creature with the {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} condition.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
entries: The striga is immune to Contamination and has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against contaminated spells. It may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Necrotic Aura
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the striga takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Necrotic damage.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The striga regains 10 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the striga takes Radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the striga's next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The striga can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The striga has the traits described in the "Vampire Weaknesses" sidebar.

reaction.name: Retaliation
entries: {@actTrigger} A creature within 15 feet of the striga deals Radiant damage to it. {@actResponse} The striga makes a Claws attack against that creature.

The striga always takes its turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On its turn, the striga can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the striga takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn

legendary.name: Necrotic Bite (1/Round)
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 10}, reach 10 ft. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) Necrotic damage. The target's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and the striga regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to that amount.

legendary.name: Claws
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 10}, reach 15 ft. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) Slashing damage.

legendary.name: Delerium Healing
entries: The striga touches a delerium shard and regains 10 ({@dice 3d6}) {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Once the striga has used a delerium shard in this way, it can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

legendary.name: Blood Howl (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 18}, each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the striga that can hear it. {@actSaveFail} 35 ({@damage 10d6}) Psychic damage, and the target has the Jinxed ({@dice 1d6}) and Immobilized conditions (save ends both). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage, and the target is immune to the striga's Blood Howl for 24 hours.

legendary.name: Charge
entries: The striga moves up to 40 feet in a straight line, moving through the spaces of other creatures. Each creature whose space the striga passes through is subjected to the following effect. {@actSave dex} {@dc 18}. {@actSaveFail} The target is pushed 10 feet away from the striga and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The striga chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. The striga can use this action even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

trait.name: Aura of Dread
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of Vladimir von Drakken takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Necrotic damage.

trait.name: Reborn Transformation
entries: When Vladimir von Drakken consumes the blood of six living creatures of level or challenge rating 10 or higher, he transforms into Reborn Vladimir von Drakken. His {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} doesn't change. If he is destroyed before he can feed sufficiently, he must begin the process again when he rejuvenates.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Vladimir von Drakken regains 30 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} remaining.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If Vladimir von Drakken is destroyed in his crypt-starved form, he crumbles into ash and reforms {@dice 1d10} days later with all of his {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. His new body appears within his crypt in the Brachenwald. Casting Hallow on the druidic shrine prevents his new body from returning so long as the spell remains in effect.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the traits described in the "Vampire Weaknesses" sidebar.

Vladimir von Drakken always takes his turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On his turn, Vladimir von Drakken can use his movement and interaction as normal. However, he does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on his turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, Vladimir von Drakken takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

items.name: Bloodmourne
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 10}, reach 5 ft. {@h}26 ({@damage 6d6 + 5}) Force damage, and the target has the Bleeding condition ({@dice 4d4}).

items.name: Claws
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 10}, reach 5 ft. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) Necrotic damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 18}).

legendary.name: Bite (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 18}, one creature within 5 feet that is willing or has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}, or {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveFail} 40 ({@damage 10d6 + 5}) Necrotic damage. The target's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and Vladimir von Drakken regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to that amount. A Humanoid killed by this effect and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a Vampire Spawn under Vladimir von Drakken's control.

legendary.name: Terrifying Glare
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 18}, one creature Vladimir von Drakken can see within 120 feet. {@actSaveFail} 21 ({@damage 6d6}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. Failure by 5 or More: While {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, the target has the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition.

legendary.name: Shadow Step (1/Round)
entries: Vladimir von Drakken teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within 60 feet that is in {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} or {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}. He has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next melee attack he makes before the end of this round.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: Vladimir von Drakken chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting him and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on him. He can use this action even if he would otherwise be unable to take actions, his actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters his game statistics.
Info Test

trait.name: Ascendant Transformation
entries: When Vladimir von Drakken drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, his body explodes in a shower of gore and he reappears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet as Ascendant Vladimir von Drakken. His {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} doesn't change.

trait.name: Aura of Dread
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of Vladimir von Drakken takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) Necrotic damage.

trait.name: Bloodthirsty
entries: Vladimir von Drakken has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against a target with the {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} or Bleeding condition.

trait.name: Daywalker
entries: Vladimir von Drakken doesn't possess any Vampire Weaknesses.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Vladimir von Drakken regains 30 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} remaining.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: Vladimir von Drakken can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

reaction.name: Spell-Reflecting Strike
entries: {@actTrigger} Vladimir von Drakken makes a successful saving throw against a spell, or a spell attack misses him. {@actResponse} Vladimir von Drakken can choose another creature (including the spellcaster) he can see within 120 feet of him. The spell targets the chosen creature instead of Vladimir von Drakken. If the spell forces a saving throw, the chosen creature makes its own save. If the spell was an attack, the attack roll is rerolled against the chosen creature.

Vladimir von Drakken always takes his turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On his turn, Vladimir von Drakken can use his movement and interaction as normal. However, he does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on his turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, Vladimir von Drakken takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

items.name: Bloodmourne
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 12}, reach 5 ft. {@h}27 ({@damage 6d6 + 6}) Force damage, and the target has the Bleeding condition ({@dice 4d4}). In addition, Vladimir von Drakken can apply one of the following martial maneuvers to the target:

items.name: Advance
items.entry: Vladimir von Drakken pushes the target 15 feet, then moves up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

items.name: Hamstring
items.entry: The target has the Immobilized condition until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Overpower
items.entry: The target has the Staggered condition until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Claws
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 12}, reach 5 ft. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) Necrotic damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 20}).

legendary.name: Bite (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 20}, one creature within 5 feet that is willing or has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}, or {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveFail} 49 ({@damage 14d6}) Necrotic damage, and the target has the Weakened condition ({@dc 20} Constitution save ends). Vladimir von Drakken regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Necrotic damage dealt. A Humanoid killed by this damage rises on its next turn as a Vampire Spawn under Vladimir von Drakken's control.

legendary.name: Dominate (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 20}, one creature Vladimir von Drakken can see within 120 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. While {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, the target obeys Vladimir von Drakken's commands and can't take Reactions. Failure by 5 or More: The {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition lasts 24 hours or until Vladimir von Drakken is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Each time the target takes damage, it repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. {@actSaveSuccess} The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on its next attack roll against Vladimir von Drakken.

legendary.name: Wing Blast (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 20}, each creature in a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from Vladimir von Drakken. {@actSaveFail} 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target is pushed 10 feet away from Vladimir von Drakken and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} Before or after using this Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, Vladimir von Drakken can move up to half his {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

legendary.name: Shadow Step (2/Round)
entries: Vladimir von Drakken teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within 60 feet that is in {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} or {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}. He has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next melee attack he makes before the end of this round.

legendary.name: Shape-Shift (1/Round)
entries: Vladimir von Drakken shape-shifts into a Tiny bat ({@variantrule Speed|XPHB} 5 ft., {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} 30 ft.) or a Medium cloud of mist ({@variantrule Speed|XPHB} 5 ft., {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} 20 ft. [hover]), or he returns to his vampire form. Anything he is wearing transforms with him.

While in bat or mist form, Vladimir von Drakken can't speak. His game statistics, other than his size and {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, are unchanged, but he can't use Epic Actions other than Shape-Shift and Epic {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB}.

While in mist form, Vladimir von Drakken can't speak or manipulate objects, and loses his Aura of Dread. He is weightless and can enter an enemy's space and stop there. If air can pass through a space, the mist can do so, but it can't pass through liquid. He has {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all damage.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: Vladimir von Drakken chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting him and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on him. He can use this action even if he would otherwise be unable to take actions, his actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters his game statistics.

trait.name: Aura of Dread
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of Vladimir von Drakken takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) Necrotic damage.

trait.name: Daywalker
entries: Vladimir von Drakken doesn't possess any Vampire Weaknesses.

trait.name: Reborn Transformation
entries: When he finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, Vladimir von Drakken reverts to his Reborn Vladimir von Drakken form.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Vladimir von Drakken regains 30 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} remaining.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If Vladimir von Drakken is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or dies, he drops to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead unless he is killed by a creature with the blood of House von Drakken within them.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: Vladimir von Drakken can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

reaction.name: Blood Rage (1/Day)
entries: {@actTrigger} Vladimir von Drakken becomes {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}. He can use this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} even if he has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition or is otherwise unable to take Reactions. {@actResponse} All conditions and spells on Vladimir von Drakken end unless he chooses to be affected by them, and he can move up to his {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} without provoking Opportunity Attacks and ignoring {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. Vladimir von Drakken recharges and immediately uses Soul Rending.

Vladimir von Drakken always takes his turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On his turn, Vladimir von Drakken can use his movement and interaction as normal. However, he does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on his turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, Vladimir von Drakken takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

items.name: Bloodmourne
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 15}, reach 5 ft. {@h}35 ({@damage 6d8 + 8}) Force damage, and the target has the Bleeding condition ({@dice 4d4}).

items.name: Claws
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 15}, reach 5 ft. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d8 + 8}) Necrotic damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 23}).

legendary.name: Bite (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 23}, one creature within 5 feet that is willing or has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}, or {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveFail} 70 ({@damage 20d6}) Necrotic damage, and the target has the Weakened condition ({@dc 22} Constitution save ends). Vladimir von Drakken regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the Necrotic damage dealt. A Humanoid killed by this damage rises on its next turn as a Vampire Spawn under Vladimir von Drakken's control.

legendary.name: Soul Rending {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 23}, each creature in a 60-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. {@actSaveFail} 54 ({@damage 12d8}) Necrotic damage. Failure by 5 or More: Double damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

legendary.name: Terrifying Glare
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 23}, one creature Vladimir von Drakken can see within 120 feet. {@actSaveFail} 25 ({@damage 6d6 + 4}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. Failure by 5 or More: While {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, the target has the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition.

legendary.name: Wing Blast (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 23}, each creature in a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from Vladimir von Drakken. {@actSaveFail} 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target is pushed 10 feet away from Vladimir von Drakken and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} Before or after using this Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, Vladimir von Drakken can move up to half his {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

legendary.name: Aerial Maneuver (1/Round)
entries: Vladimir von Drakken moves up to his {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance

He can use this action even if he would otherwise be unable to take actions, his actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters his game statistics.

entries: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the dragon takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Mage Hand

headerEntries: The far dweller casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 19}, +11 to spell attacks): At Will: {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB}, {@spell Magic Missile|XPHB} (level 5 version). 1/Day Each: {@spell Dominate Monster|XPHB}, {@spell Hypnotic Pattern|XPHB}, {@spell Mass Suggestion|XPHB}, {@spell Maze|XPHB}, {@spell Plane Shift|XPHB} (self only), {@spell Scrying|XPHB}, {@spell Slow|XPHB}, {@spell Telekinesis|XPHB}.

entries: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the far dweller takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Psychic damage.

If the far dweller is targeted by a spell of level 4 or lower, the caster must succeed on a {@dc 19} Intelligence saving throw or the spell fails and the caster takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) Psychic damage.

reaction.name: Step Through Time and Space
entries: {@actTrigger} The far dweller takes damage. {@actResponse} The far dweller takes no damage and teleports to an unoccupied space within 60 feet. The next attack roll made against the far dweller has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

The far dweller always takes its turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On its turn, the far dweller can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the far dweller takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

items.name: Tentacle

entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 19}, each creature in a 60-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} (creatures maintaining {@status Concentration|XPHB} have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}). {@actSaveFail} 42 ({@damage 12d6}) Psychic damage, or 72 Psychic damage if the target was maintaining {@status Concentration|XPHB}. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

legendary.name: Pluck the Puppet Strings (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 19}, one creature within 120 feet of the far dweller. {@actSaveFail} 28 ({@damage 8d6}) Psychic damage, and the target must immediately use its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move up to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} toward a creature of the far dweller's choice. If it ends this movement within reach of the creature, it must make a melee weapon attack against the creature with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

legendary.name: Phase Out (1/Round)
entries: The far dweller teleports to an unoccupied space within 120 feet of it.
