Each creature within 10 feet of the far dweller when it arrives is subjected to the following effect. {@actSave int} {@dc 19}. {@actSaveFail} 21 ({@damage 6d6}) Psychic damage, and the target has the Defenseless condition until the end of its next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The far dweller chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. The far dweller can use this action even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

monster.name: Entropic Watcher
languages: Understand all languages but can't speak; telepathy 120 ft.

trait.name: Aberrant Traits
entries: The entropic watcher has the traits described in the "Aberrant Traits" sidebar.

trait.name: Corrupting Aura
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the entropic watcher takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Necrotic damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The entropic watcher has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Withering Gaze
entries: The entropic watcher's eye creates a 150-foot long, 10-foot wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} of withering magic. At the start of each of its turns, the entropic watcher decides which way the line faces and whether the line is active. Creatures in the {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} have {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to Necrotic damage and can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

The entropic watcher always takes its turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On its turn, the entropic watcher can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the entropic watcher takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

items.name: Tendrils
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 10}, reach 40 ft. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) Bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) Necrotic damage, and if the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 18}). While {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition. The entropic watcher has ten tendrils, each of which can grapple one creature.

items.name: Insanity Beam (1/Round)
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 10}, range 60 ft. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d10}) Necrotic damage, and the beam leaps to another target. The entropic watcher makes another Insanity Beam attack against a new target within 30 feet of the first. A creature can be targeted by only one Insanity Beam per turn. For each additional creature the beam hits, its damage increases by 5 ({@dice 1d10}).

legendary.name: Dimensional Glide
entries: The entropic watcher moves up to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

legendary.name: Shadow Crash {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 18}, each creature in a 30-foot radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on a point the entropic watcher can see within 150 feet. {@actSaveFail} 36 ({@damage 8d8}) Necrotic damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere}'s area is filled with magical {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB} for 1 minute or until the entropic watcher uses Shadow Crash again. A creature that ends its turn in the area takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) Necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Contaminated Grasp
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 18}, one creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by the entropic watcher. {@actSaveFail} 16 ({@damage 3d10}) Necrotic damage, and the target gains one Contamination level. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

legendary.name: Force Barrier
entries: The entropic watcher creates a shimmering octarine 10-foot-by-10-foot wall of force centered on a point within 150 feet. The wall lasts for 1 minute or until the entropic watcher has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition or dies. The wall appears in any orientation it chooses, and can be free floating or resting on a solid surface. If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (the entropic watcher's choice). Nothing can physically pass through the wall. It is immune to all damage and can't be dispelled by {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB}. A {@spell Disintegrate|XPHB} spell destroys the wall instantly, however. The wall also extends into the Ethereal Plane, blocking ethereal travel through the wall.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The entropic watcher chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. The entropic watcher can use this action even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (1/Round)
headerEntries: He Who Laughs Last casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 26}): At Will: {@spell Animate Dead|XPHB} (level 9 version), {@spell Speak with Dead|XPHB}. 3/Day Each: {@spell Create Undead|XPHB} (level 9 version), {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB}, {@spell Dream|XPHB}, {@spell Project Image|XPHB}, {@spell Scrying|XPHB}, {@spell Teleport|XPHB}. 1/Year: {@spell Wish|XPHB}.

trait.name: Inscrutable
entries: He Who Laughs Last is immune to any effect that would sense his emotions or read his thoughts, as well as any divination spell that he refuses. Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) checks made to ascertain the demon lord's intentions or sincerity have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

trait.name: Mortal Coil
entries: He Who Laughs Last projects a 150-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of death and decay. A creature that ends its turn in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} suffers an {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level and ages 10 ({@dice 3d6}) years. The creature removes an {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level gained in this way at the end of its turn, but only if it ends its turn outside the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}. A creature's original age can be restored with {@spell Greater Restoration|XPHB} or similar magic.

He Who Laughs Last always takes his turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On his turn, He Who Laughs Last can use his movement and interaction as normal. However, he does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on his turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, He Who Laughs Last takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

items.name: Scornful Whip
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 16}, reach 120 ft. {@h}30 ({@damage 5d8 + 8}) Force damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it is pulled 30 feet toward He Who Laughs Last.

items.name: Walking Shadow (1/Round)
entries: He Who Laughs Last moves up to half his {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

legendary.name: Sleep No More (1/Round)
entries: He Who Laughs Last casts {@spell Power Word Kill|XPHB}.

legendary.name: Out Brief Candle (1/Round)
entries: He Who Laughs Last casts {@spell Finger of Death|XPHB} (save {@dc 24}).

legendary.name: Dusty Death (1/Round)
entries: He Who Laughs Last casts {@spell Disintegrate|XPHB} (save {@dc 24}).

legendary.name: Cage of Sorrows (1/Round)
entries: He Who Laughs Last creates a wall of bone on a solid surface it can see within 120 feet of himself. The wall appears as a flat surface made up of one 10-foot-square panel. The wall is 1 foot thick and lasts for 1 minute or until the wall is destroyed (AC 15, 20 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison and Psychic damage, {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to Bludgeoning and Thunder damage). If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (GM's choice) and subjected to the following effect. {@actSave dex} {@dc 16}. {@actSaveFail} 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Piercing damage.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: He Who Laughs Last chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting him and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on him. He Who Laughs Last can use this action even if he would otherwise be unable to take actions, his actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters his game statistics.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics; 1/Round)
headerEntries: The Thing with the Writhing Tail casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 26}): At Will: {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB}, {@spell Dominate Beast|XPHB}, {@spell Suggestion|XPHB}. 3/Day Each: Black Tentacles, {@spell Dream|XPHB}, {@spell Greater Invisibility|XPHB}, {@spell Major Image|XPHB} (level 4 version), {@spell Mirror Image|XPHB}, {@spell Project Image|XPHB}, {@spell Scrying|XPHB}, {@spell Sending|XPHB}, {@spell Telekinesis|XPHB}. 1/Day Each: {@spell Maze|XPHB}, {@spell Teleport|XPHB}. 1/Year: {@spell Gate|XPHB}, {@spell Wish|XPHB}.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the Thing with the Writhing Tail is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The Thing with the Writhing Tail can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Inscrutable
entries: The Thing with the Writhing Tail is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) checks made to ascertain the being's intentions or sincerity have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

trait.name: Purring Aura
entries: The Thing with the Writhing Tail projects a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of madness and dread. A creature that ends its turn in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition for 1 hour. A creature can take an action to attempt to overcome its fear, making a {@dc 25} Wisdom saving throw. {@actSaveFail} The target takes 27 ({@damage 5d10}) Psychic damage. {@actSaveSuccess} The {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition ends for that creature, and it becomes immune to the Purring Aura of the Thing with the Writhing Tail for 24 hours.

trait.name: Quantum Displacement
entries: The Thing with the Writhing Tail shifts between realities and timelines. Attack rolls against it have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}, and it has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws. If it is hit by an attack or fails a saving throw, this trait is disrupted until it uses Phase Displacement. This trait is also disrupted while the Thing with the Writhing Tail has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition or a {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} of 0.

The Thing with the Writhing Tail always takes its turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On its turn, The Thing with the Writhing Tail can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, The Thing with the Writhing Tail takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn

legendary.name: Cosmic Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 15}, reach 10 ft. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 8}) Force damage.

legendary.name: Tail Whip
entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 26}, one creature the Thing with the Writhing Tail can see within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} 35 ({@damage 10d6}) Psychic damage, and the target has the Dazed condition (save ends). Failure by 5 or More: 70 ({@damage 20d6}) Psychic damage, and the target instead has the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition (save ends). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

legendary.name: Manifest Duplicate (1/Round)
entries: The Thing with the Writhing Tail creates a perfect visual illusion of itself in an unoccupied space it can see within 300 feet. The illusion is intangible and doesn't occupy its space. The duplicate lasts for 1 minute, but it ends early if the Thing with the Writhing Tail dismisses it (no action required) or has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. The Thing with the Writhing Tail can have up to eight illusory duplicates at a time. While it has one or more duplicates, it has the following benefits

legendary.name: -Attacks and Spells
entries: The Thing with the Writhing Tail can cast spells, use Tail Whip, and make Claw attacks as if it was in an illusory duplicate's space.

legendary.name: -Aura Expansion
entries: Each illusory duplicate emanates a Purring Aura. The effects of multiple overlapping auras do not stack; a creature is only affected once by the Purring Aura even if it is within range of multiple Emanations.

legendary.name: -Move
entries: Each time the Thing with the Writhing Tail takes this Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, it can move any number of illusions up to 60 feet to unoccupied spaces within 300 feet of itself.

legendary.name: -Distract
entries: When both the Thing with the Writhing Tail and one of its illusory duplicates are within 10 feet of a creature that can see them, the Thing with the Writhing Tail has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against that creature.

legendary.name: -Sense
entries: The Thing with the Writhing Tail can see and hear through each of its illusory duplicates.

legendary.name: Phase Displacement
entries: The Thing with the Writhing Tail teleports, swapping places with one of its illusory duplicates. If its Quantum Displacement trait was disrupted, it is no longer disrupted.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The Thing with the Writhing Tail chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting it and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. The Thing with the Writhing Tail can use this action even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics; 1/Round)
headerEntries: The Whispered Promise casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 25}): At Will: {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB}, {@spell Suggestion|XPHB}. 3/Day Each: {@spell Dimension Door|XPHB}, {@spell Dream|XPHB}, {@spell Invisibility|XPHB}, {@spell Major Image|XPHB} (level 4 version), {@spell Sending|XPHB}. 1/Day Each: {@spell Dominate Monster|XPHB}, {@spell Mass Suggestion|XPHB}, {@spell Project Image|XPHB}, {@spell Scrying|XPHB}. 1/Year: {@spell Wish|XPHB}.

trait.name: Alluring Aura
entries: The Whispered Promise projects a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of beguiling enchantment. A creature that ends its turn in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for 1 hour. Each time the creature takes damage other than Psychic damage, it makes a {@dc 25} Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition ends for that creature, and it is immune to the Alluring Aura of the Whispered Promise for 24 hours.

trait.name: Change Shape
entries: The Whispered Promise has no true form and chooses how they manifest to each creature (no action required). Their form can be anything they wish; they can appear like a creature, object, or even as a multisensory representation of an abstract concept. They can appear to be any form that is Large or smaller, but their game statistics are the same in each form.

trait.name: Inscrutable
entries: The Whispered Promise is immune to any effect that would sense their emotions or read their thoughts, as well as any divination spell that they refuse. Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) checks made to ascertain the Whispered Promise's intentions or sincerity have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

trait.name: Glibness
entries: When they make a Charisma ({@skill Deception|XPHB}) check, the Whispered Promise treats any roll of 14 or less on the {@dice d20} as 15.

trait.name: Unravelling Resolve
entries: Creatures {@condition grappled} by the Whispered Promise can't benefit from resistance and immunity to Psychic damage or the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition.

The Whispered Promise always takes their turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On their turn, the Whispered Promise can use their movement and interaction as normal. However, they do not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on their turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the Whispered Promise takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

items.name: Tendril
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 17}, reach 10 ft. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) Force damage, and the target has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 25}). While {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition.

items.name: Whispers (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 25}, one creature the Whispered Promise can see within 300 feet. {@actSaveFail} 35 ({@damage 10d6}) Psychic damage, and the target is Dazed (save ends). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage. Failure by 5 or more: Double damage, and the target is {@condition Stunned|XPHB} until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Promises (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave cha} {@dc 25}, one creature the Whispered Promise can see within 300 feet. {@actSaveFail} 35 ({@damage 10d6}) Psychic damage, and the target is Jinxed ({@dice 1d10}) (save ends). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage. Failure by 5 or more: Double damage, and the target becomes cursed. While cursed, the target can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and gains no benefits from taking a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

legendary.name: Unfettered Glide
entries: The Whispered Promise moves up to their {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

legendary.name: Dominate (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 25}, one creature the Whispered Promise can see within 300 feet. {@actSaveFail} The creature has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. While {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, the target obeys the Whispered Promise's commands and can't take Reactions. Failure by 5 or More: The {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition instead lasts for 24 hours or until the Whispered Promise is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Each time the target takes damage, it repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. {@actSaveSuccess} The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on its next attack roll against the Whispered Promise.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The Whispered Promise chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on them. The Whispered Promise can use this action even if they would otherwise be unable to take actions, their actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters their game statistics.

trait.name: Mass of Tails
entries: Ranged attacks against the Rat God from further than 60 feet away have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

trait.name: Verminous Aura
entries: The Rat God is surrounded by a 60-foot radius of vermin, pouring out of it and spilling over into the area as they claw and gnash. The area is {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} and a creature that starts its turn in the area takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) Necrotic damage.

The Rat God always takes its turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On its turn, the Rat God can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the Rat God takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

items.name: Flail of Skulls
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 16}, reach 15 ft. {@h}28 ({@damage 3d12 + 9}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the {@hazard Burning|XPHB} condition ({@dice 3d6} Acid).

items.name: Great Feeding
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 26}, each creature within 60 feet of the Rat God. {@actSaveFail} 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Piercing damage, and the target has the Sickened condition (save ends). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The Rat God regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the total damage dealt to all targets.

legendary.name: Rodent Rifts (1/Round)
entries: The Rat God teleports to an unoccupied space within 120 feet. Each creature within 15 feet of the Rat God when it arrives is subjected to the following effect. {@actSave str} {@dc 26}. {@actSaveFail} 28 ({@damage 8d6}) Necrotic damage, and the target is pushed 10 feet away from the Rat God.

legendary.name: Warp Bolt
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 22}, one creature the Rat God can see within 120 feet. {@actSaveFail} 23 ({@damage 4d12}) Necrotic damage, and the target suffers a Contamination level.

legendary.name: Infernal Chittering
entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 26}, one creature the Rat God can see within 60 feet that can hear the Rat God. {@actSaveFail} 18 ({@damage 4d8}) Psychic damage, and the target has the Weakened condition (save ends).

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The Rat God chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. The Rat God can use this action even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (1/Round)
headerEntries: The Algorithm casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 27}): At Will: {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB}, {@spell Fabricate|XPHB}. 3/Day Each: {@spell Scrying|XPHB}, {@spell Sending|XPHB}, {@spell Wall of Force|XPHB}. 1/Day Each: {@spell Antimagic Field|XPHB}, {@spell Prismatic Wall|XPHB}, {@spell Reverse Gravity|XPHB}. 1/Year: {@spell Wish|XPHB}.

trait.name: Electronic Data Network
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the Algorithm takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) Lightning damage.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The Algorithm is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Predictive Analytics
entries: At the end of each of the Algorithm's turns, it rolls {@dice 1d20} for each player character fighting it. The Algorithm can replace any {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} made by it or a creature it can see with one of these predictive rolls. It must choose to do so before the roll, and it can replace a roll in this way only once per turn. Each predictive roll can be used only once. Any unused predictive rolls are lost at the start of the Algorithm's next turn.

The Algorithm always takes its turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On its turn, the Algorithm can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the Algorithm takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

items.name: Wire
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 26}, one creature the Algorithm can see within 60 feet. {@actSaveFail} 21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) Force damage, and if the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 20}). The Algorithm can grapple up to six creatures at a time.

items.name: Algorithmic Manipulation
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 26}, one Huge or smaller creature or object the Algorithm can see within 120 feet. {@actSaveFail} The Algorithm moves the target up to 30 feet in any direction, and the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition. If the Algorithm lifts the target into the air, it is suspended there. The target remains held until the Algorithm releases it (no action required), uses this Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} again, or has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

items.name: Deatomization
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 26}, one creature or object the Algorithm can see within 300 feet. {@actSaveFail} 65 ({@damage 10d12}) Necrotic damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it dies and its body is reduced to atoms. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

legendary.name: Reprogram (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 26}, one creature {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by the Algorithm. {@actSaveFail} 55 ({@damage 10d10}) Piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it dies and its brain is replaced with mechanical components. The target reanimates at the start of its next turn as a Construct under the Algorithm's control. It resembles the original creature, but its eyes glow with synthetic green light, and its body is covered in protruding wires, metal scraps, and glowing tubes.

legendary.name: Assuming Direct Control (1/Round)
entries: The Algorithm targets a Construct within 120 feet and immediately enters and takes control of it. The Algorithm can still use its Epic Actions as normal and replaces the Construct's game statistics with its own, except the Construct's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. When the Construct is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, the Algorithm reemerges in an unoccupied space within 15 feet of it.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The Algorithm chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. The Algorithm can use this action even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (1/Round)
headerEntries: Eldrick casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 21}, +13 to spell attacks): At Will: {@spell Mage Armor|XPHB} (included above), {@spell Mage Hand|XPHB}, {@spell Sending|XPHB}. 2/Day Each: Arcane Hand (Eldrick may use an Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} to control the hand once per round), {@spell Banishment|XPHB}, {@spell Dimension Door|XPHB}, {@spell Ice Storm|XPHB}, {@spell Lightning Bolt|XPHB}, {@spell Scrying|XPHB}, {@spell Wall of Force|XPHB}.

spellcasting.name: Greater Spellcasting (1/Round)
headerEntries: Eldrick casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 21}, +13 to spell attacks): 1/Day Each: {@spell Forcecage|XPHB}, {@spell Globe of Invulnerability|XPHB}, {@spell Maze|XPHB}, {@spell Prismatic Spray|XPHB}, {@spell Prismatic Wall|XPHB}, Teleport.

trait.name: Academy Rings (1/Day)
entries: Eldrick can cast a spell from Spellcasting without expending a use of it.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Eldrick has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Warding Aura
entries: Eldrick projects a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of warding magic. The first time on each turn that a creature within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} deals damage or casts a spell on Eldrick, that creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Force damage and is pushed 10 feet away from Eldrick.

reaction.name: Counterspell
entries: Eldrick casts {@spell Counterspell|XPHB} in response to that spell's trigger, using the spellcasting ability from Spellcasting.

Eldrick always takes his turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On his turn, Eldrick can use his movement and interaction as normal. However, he does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on his turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, Eldrick takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn

legendary.name: Prismatic Blast
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 15}, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) Cold, Fire, or Lightning damage (Eldrick's choice).

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: Eldrick teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within 60 feet.

legendary.name: Chain Lightning {@recharge 5}
entries: Eldrick casts {@spell Chain Lightning|XPHB}, using the spellcasting ability in Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Dispel Magic (1/Round)
entries: Eldrick casts {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB}, using the spellcasting ability in Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: Eldrick chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting him and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on him. Eldrick can use this action even if he would otherwise be unable to take actions, his actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters his game statistics.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (1/Round)
headerEntries: The Queen of Thieves casts one of the following spells, requiring no Verbal or Somatic components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}, +10 to spell attacks): At Will: {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB}, {@spell Disguise Self|XPHB}, {@spell Invisibility|XPHB}, {@spell Mage Armor|XPHB} (included above), {@spell Suggestion|XPHB}. 2/Day Each: {@spell Charm Monster|XPHB}, {@spell Dimension Door|XPHB}, {@spell Dominate Person|XPHB}, {@spell Gaseous Form|XPHB}, {@spell Greater Invisibility|XPHB}, {@spell Hypnotic Pattern|XPHB}, {@spell Major Image|XPHB} (level 4 version), {@spell Mirror Image|XPHB}, {@spell Scrying|XPHB}, {@spell Sending|XPHB}, {@spell Sleep|XPHB}. 1/Day Each: Feeblemind, {@spell Mass Suggestion|XPHB}, {@spell Project Image|XPHB}, {@spell Seeming|XPHB}.

trait.name: Canny Defense
entries: While the Queen of Thieves is wearing light or no armor and wielding no shield, her AC includes her Intelligence modifier (included above).

trait.name: Masked Identity
entries: The Queen of Thieves is immune to any effect that would sense her emotions or read her thoughts, as well as any divination spell that she refuses. Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) checks made to ascertain her intentions or sincerity have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

trait.name: Memory Thief
entries: Creatures are not aware when the Queen of Thieves reads their thoughts or imposes the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition on them. Additionally, when a spell cast by her that causes creatures to become {@condition Charmed|XPHB} ends, she can make affected creatures lose their memories. Each creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw or forget up to 8 hours of the time spent {@condition Charmed|XPHB} by her. These memories can be restored with a {@spell Heal|XPHB} spell or similar magic.

trait.name: Vexing Aura
entries: The Queen of Thieves projects a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of bewitching magic. At the start of each of her turns, she can choose the aura's effect, which applies to creatures of her choice in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}:

items.name: Enchanting Presence
items.entry: A creature that starts its turn in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition until it ends its turn outside the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}. If she deals damage to the creature, the condition ends, and that creature is immune to her Enchanting Presence for 24 hours.

items.name: Mocking Laughter
items.entry: A creature that starts its turn in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Psychic damage.

entries: The Queen of Thieves always takes her turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On her turn, she can use her movement and interaction as normal. However, she does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on her turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, she takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn

legendary.name: +3 Rapier
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 13}, reach 5 ft. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d8 + 8}) Piercing damage plus 35 ({@damage 10d6}) Poison damage.

legendary.name: Cutting Words
entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 18}, one creature within 120 feet of the Queen of Thieves. {@actSaveFail} 35 ({@damage 10d6}) Psychic damage, and the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} it makes before the end of its next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

legendary.name: Dash
entries: The Queen of Thieves moves up to her {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

legendary.name: Misdirection (1/Round)
entries: The Queen of Thieves becomes {@condition Invisible|XPHB} and teleports to an unoccupied space she can see within 60 feet. At the same time, an illusory double of her appears where she was standing. The illusory double, as well as the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition, end if the Queen of Thieves attacks or casts a spell, or after 1 minute.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The Queen of Thieves chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting her and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on her. She can use this action even if she would otherwise be unable to take actions, her actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters her game statistics.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (1/Round)
headerEntries: Lucretia casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 20}, +12 to spell attacks; spells other than cantrips are cast at level 9): At Will: {@spell Guidance|XPHB}, {@spell Light|XPHB}, {@spell Thaumaturgy|XPHB}. 2/Day Each: {@spell Aid|XPHB}, {@spell Bless|XPHB}, {@spell Banishment|XPHB}, {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB}, {@spell Flame Strike|XPHB}, {@spell Hold Person|XPHB}, {@spell Mass Cure Wounds|XPHB}, {@spell Sending|XPHB}. 1/Day Each: {@spell Commune|XPHB}, {@spell Death Ward|XPHB}, {@spell Divination|XPHB}, {@spell Scrying|XPHB}, {@spell Speak with Dead|XPHB}.

spellcasting.name: Greater Spellcasting (1/Round)
headerEntries: Lucretia casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 20}, +12 to spell attacks; spells other than cantrips are cast at level 9): 1/Day Each: {@spell Gate|XPHB}, {@spell Greater Restoration|XPHB}, {@spell Heal|XPHB}, {@spell Heroes' Feast|XPHB}, {@spell Resurrection|XPHB}, {@spell Word of Recall|XPHB}.

trait.name: Holy Aura
entries: Lucretia projects a 60-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of holy power. At the start of each of her turns, she can choose the aura's effect, which applies to creatures of her choice in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}:

items.name: Divine Grace
items.entry: Creatures in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} that target Lucretia with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This effect doesn't protect Lucretia from area effects. If Lucretia makes an attack, casts a spell that affects an enemy, or deals damage to another creature, this trait ends until the start of her next turn.

items.name: Pacifying Presence
items.entry: A creature that starts its turn in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} has the Weakened condition until the start of its next turn.

items.name: Wrathful Flame
items.entry: A creature that starts its turn in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Radiant damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Fire damage.

trait.name: Prescient
entries: Lucretia can't be {@status surprised|XPHB} while she is conscious.

trait.name: Sanctified by Falling Fire
entries: When Lucretia dies, her soul is pulled into the delerium crystal embedded in her chest.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While Lucretia is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, her AC includes her Wisdom modifier (included above).

trait.name: Undeniable Faith
entries: Lucretia automatically succeeds on Constitution saving throws to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} on her spells.

Lucretia always takes her turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On her turn, Lucretia can use her movement and interaction as normal. However, she does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on her turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, Lucretia takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

items.name: Pacifying Touch
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 20}, one creature within 5 feet of Lucretia. {@actSaveFail} 35 ({@damage 10d6}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition (save ends). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} If this damage reduces the target to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, the target is stabilized but has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition for 1 hour, even after regaining {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

items.name: Sacred Flame
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 20}, one creature within 60 feet of Lucretia. {@actSaveFail} 45 ({@damage 10d8}) Radiant damage, and the target has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

legendary.name: Divine Intervention (1/Day)
entries: Lucretia chooses any spell which doesn't require a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to cast. As part of this Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, she casts that spell without Material components. If she uses this Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} to cast the {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell, she can't use this Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} for the next {@dice 1d4} days.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: Lucretia chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting her and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on her. Lucretia can use this action even if she would otherwise be unable to take actions, her actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters her game statistics.

trait.name: Intimidating Aura
entries: Elias projects a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of imposing command. An ally that starts its turn in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} has advantage on the first attack roll it makes before the start of its next turn. A hostile creature that starts its turn in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) thunder damage and is subjected to the following effect: Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} {@dc 16}. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition frightened} condition until the start of its next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} The target is immune to Elias's Intimidating Aura for 24 hours.

action.name: Epic Actions
entries: Elias always takes his turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On his turn, Elias can use his movement and interaction as normal, but he does not take an action or bonus action unless forced to by a spell or other effect. Instead, Elias takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn.

action.name: Lord Commander's Blade
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 12}, reach 5 ft. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) slashing damage, and Elias can apply one of the following martial masteries to the target:

items.name: * Wound
entries: The target has the bleeding condition ({@dice 4d4}).

items.name: * Topple
entries: The target has the {@condition prone} condition.

items.name: * Sap
entries: The target has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the start of Elias's next turn.

items.name: Longbow
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 12}, range 150/600 ft. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) piercing damage, and Elias can apply one of the following martial masteries to the target

items.name: * Push
entries: If the target is Large or smaller, it is pushed up to 10 feet away from Elias.

items.name: * Slow
entries: The target has the slowed condition (Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} {@dc 15} save ends).

action.name: Command
entries: Elias chooses one ally he can see. If the ally can see and hear him, it can use its reaction to make one weapon attack with advantage. On a hit, the attack deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage.

action.name: Flare (1/Round)
entries: Elias chooses a point he can see within 60 feet and fires a flare at it, signaling the Hooded Lantern's bombardment. Elias recharges his Artillery Strike. He can only use this Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} if it is the first Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} he has taken this round.

action.name: Artillery Strike (Special Recharge)
entries: Elias can only use this Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} if it is the last Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} he takes this round. Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} {@dc 17}, each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the point Elias chose with his Flare Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB}. {@actSaveFail} 18 ({@damage 4d8}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage, and the target has the {@condition prone} condition. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

action.name: Epic Resistance
entries: Elias chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting him and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11 or higher, the effect ends. This can be used even if he is unable to take actions, is being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters his game statistics.

trait.name: Aura of Righteousness
entries: Theodore projects a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of radiant power. Allies in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws. A hostile creature that starts its turn in the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Radiant damage.

Theodore always takes his turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On his turn, Theodore can use his movement and interaction as normal. However, he does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on his turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, Theodore takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

items.name: Holy Avenger Longsword
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 13}, reach 5 ft. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) Slashing damage, and the target suffers one of the following effects of Theodore's choice.

items.name: Divine Smite
items.entry: {@actSave wis} {@dc 17}. {@actSaveFail} 18 ({@damage 4d8}) Radiant damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

items.name: Searing Smite
items.entry: {@actSave dex} {@dc 17}. {@actSaveFail} 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Fire damage, and the target has the {@hazard Burning|XPHB} condition ({@dice 4d6} Fire). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

items.name: Thunderous Smite
items.entry: {@actSave str} {@dc 17}. {@actSaveFail} 9 ({@damage 2d8}) Thunder damage, and the target is pushed up to 10 feet away from Theodore and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

items.name: Shield
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 13}, reach 5 ft. or range 30/90 ft. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the Dazed condition until the end of its next turn. {@hom}After being thrown, the shield returns to Theodore's hand.

legendary.name: Charge (1/Round)
entries: Theodore moves up to his {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} toward a hostile creature he can see. He gains {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next weapon attack he makes this round.

legendary.name: Call the Sacred Flame {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 17}, each creature in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high {@variantrule Cylinder [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cylinder} centered on a point within 60 feet of Theodore. {@actSaveFail} 21 ({@damage 6d6}) Radiant damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) Fire damage, and the target has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition (save ends).

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: Theodore chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting him and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on him. Theodore can use this action even if he would otherwise be unable to take actions, his actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters his game statistics.

monster.name: Bigger Linda

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If Bigger Linda is destroyed and her corpse is left within an area of the Deep Haze for 1 hour, she is revived with all of her hit points.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: When Bigger Linda starts her turn in an area of the Deep Haze, she regains 20 hit points. Bigger Linda dies only if she starts her turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Haze Aura
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of Bigger Linda must make a Constitution saving throw {@dc 22}. On a failed save, the target gains a Contamination level. On a failed or successful save, the creature also takes {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: Bigger Linda deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: Bigger Linda is immune to any spell or effect that would alter her form.

legendaryHeader: Bigger Linda always takes her turn on initiative count 20. On her turn, Bigger Linda can use her movement and interaction as normal, but she does not take an action or bonus action unless forced to do so by a spell or effect. Instead, she takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 15}, reach 10 ft. {@h}{@damage 4d12 + 9} piercing damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 23}). While {@condition grappled}, the target is also {@condition restrained}, and Bigger Linda can't Bite another target.

legendary.name: Tail
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 15}, reach 15 ft. {@h}{@damage 3d8 + 9} bludgeoning damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is pushed 20 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Stomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 15}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@damage 3d10 + 9} bludgeoning damage. Target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw {@dc 23} or become Staggered (save ends).

legendary.name: Breathe Deep
entries: Bigger Linda's Breath Weapon recharges. She can only take this Epic Action as the first one she uses in a round. After using this action, she can't take her Bite Epic Action until the start of the next round.

legendary.name: Breath Weapon (Special Recharge)
entries: Each creature in a 60-foot long, 5-foot wide line must make a Dexterity saving throw {@dc 22}. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 7d8} necrotic damage plus {@damage 7d8} force damage and gains a Contamination level. On a success, the creature takes half damage only.

legendary.name: Trampling Rampage (Recharges When Bloodied)
entries: Bigger Linda moves up to her speed in a straight line, moving through spaces of Large or smaller creatures in her path. She makes one Stomp attack against each creature she moves through.

legendary.name: Teleport (1/Round)
entries: Bigger Linda teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space she can see within the Deep Haze.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: Bigger Linda chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting her and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11 or higher, the effect ends. She can use this even if she would otherwise be unable to act, is controlled by another creature, or if her statistics are being altered.

monster.name: Bigger Linda

trait.name: Haze Aura
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of Bigger Linda is subjected to the following effect: Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} {@dc 22}. {@actSaveFail} The target gains a Contamination level. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: Bigger Linda has immunity to any spell or effect that would alter her form.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: When Bigger Linda starts her turn in an area of the Deep Haze, she regains 20 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Bigger Linda dies only if she starts her turn with 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If Bigger Linda is destroyed and her corpse is left within an area of the Deep Haze for 1 hour, she is revived with all of her {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: Bigger Linda deals double damage to objects and structures.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 15}, reach 10 ft. {@h}35 ({@damage 4d12 + 9}) piercing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 23}). While {@condition grappled}, the target is {@condition restrained} and Bigger Linda can't Bite another target.

legendary.name: Tail
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 15}, reach 15 ft. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it is pushed 20 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Stomp
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 15}, reach 5 ft. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d10 + 9}) bludgeoning damage. Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} {@dc 23}. {@actSaveFail} The target is staggered (save ends).

legendary.name: Breath Weapon (Special Recharge)
entries: Bigger Linda's Breath Weapon recharges. This can only be taken as the first Legendary Action in a round. After using this, she can't take Bite until the start of the next round.

legendary.name: Trampling Rampage (Recharges When Bloodied)
entries: Bigger Linda moves up to her speed in a straight line, moving through spaces of Large or smaller creatures in her path, making one Stomp attack against each creature moved through.

legendary.name: Teleport (1/Round)
entries: Bigger Linda teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space she can see within the Deep Haze.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: Bigger Linda chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting her and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11 or higher, the effect ends. This can be used even if she is unable to take actions or is being controlled by another creature.

legendaryHeader: Bigger Linda always takes her turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On her turn, she can use her movement and interaction as normal, but she does not take an action or bonus action unless forced to by a spell or effect. Instead, she takes one of the following Legendary Actions at the end of each player character's turn.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
entries: The Think Tank is immune to Contamination and has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against contaminated spells. The Think Tank may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

trait.name: Life Support System
entries: The Think Tank is protected by three machine nodes that make up its Life Support System. The nodes are positioned in a triangle, each no further than 30 feet apart from the rest. Each node is a Large object with AC 20, 25 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} per player character, and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison and Psychic damage. The Think Tank can't move or be moved more than 60 feet away from any two of its Life Support System nodes.

trait.name: Nightmare Aura
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 120 feet of the Think Tank takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Psychic damage.

trait.name: Shield Generator
entries: As long as at least one machine node in the Life Support System remains, the Think Tank's Immunities can't be ignored except by effects caused by level 9 spells or artifacts. If all nodes are destroyed, the Think Tank loses its Immunities.

trait.name: Telepathic Eavesdropping
entries: The Think Tank can project its consciousness to see and hear any creature or location within 5 miles as if it had cast {@spell Scrying|XPHB} (no action required). It can read the thoughts of creatures in this area, communicate with them telepathically, and listen in on telepathic communications which occur between other creatures in the region. It remains aware of its own surroundings while doing so. It cannot observe the area within a Private Sanctum spell or locations and creatures protected by magic which blocks divination or scrying sensors.

The Think Tank always takes its turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On its turn, the Think Tank can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the Think Tank takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn:

items.name: Contaminated Blast
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 12}, reach 10 ft., or range 120 ft. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d12 + 6}) Necrotic damage. {@actSave con} {@dc 20}. {@actSaveFail} The target gains a Contamination level.

items.name: Telekinetic Grip
entries: The Think Tank reaches out with its mind to hold one creature or object it can see within 120 feet of it in its psychic grasp. If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect. {@actSave str} {@dc 20}. {@actSaveFail} 28 ({@damage 8d6}) Force damage, and the target is moved up to 30 feet in any direction and has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until it escapes or the Think Tank has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. The Think Tank can hold up to two creatures or objects in its grip at one time. On its turn, a held creature can take an action to repeat the save, escaping the grip on a success. If the target is an object weighing 1,000 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is telekinetically moved up to 30 feet in any direction. The Think Tank can also exert fine control on objects with its telekinesis, such as manipulating surgical tools or opening a door or a container.

items.name: Pluck the Puppet Strings
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 20}, one creature within 120 feet of the Think Tank. {@actSaveFail} 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Psychic damage, and the target must use its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move up to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} directly toward a creature of the Think Tank's choice. If the target ends this movement within reach of the chosen creature, it must make a melee weapon attack against that creature with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

legendary.name: Mind Cage (1/Round)
entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 20}, one creature the Think Tank can see within 120 feet. {@actSaveSuccess} 33 ({@damage 6d10}) Psychic damage. {@actSaveFail} 33 ({@damage 6d10}) Psychic damage, and the target perceives itself to be trapped within a nightmare conjured forth from the depths of its own psyche until it escapes. While trapped, the target has the Immobilized, {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, and {@condition Deafened|XPHB} conditions. On its turn, the target can take an action to repeat the save. Each time it does, it takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) Psychic damage. On a success, the effect ends for it.

legendary.name: Unbind Gravity (1/Round)
entries: The Think Tank controls gravity in a 200-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} centered on itself until the end of the next round. Each time the Think Tank uses this Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, it decides which direction gravity pulls within the area. All creatures and objects that aren't somehow anchored to the ground in the area fall in the chosen direction until they reach the edge of the area. A creature can make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw to grab onto a fixed object it can reach, avoiding the fall on a success. If some solid object (such as a ceiling) is encountered in this fall, falling objects and creatures strike it just as they would during a normal downward fall. If an object or creature reaches the edge of the area without striking anything, it remains there, oscillating slightly, for the duration. Alternatively, the Think Tank can decide to prevent gravity from acting within the area. When it does, creatures within the area without a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} levitate in midair, and must move by pushing or pulling against a fixed object or surface within reach (such as a wall or a ceiling), which allows them to move as if they were climbing. Unattended objects float around randomly. If the Think Tank doesn't use this Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} during the next round, the effect ends and affected objects and creatures fall back down.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The Think Tank chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. The Think Tank can use this action even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

monster.name: Kingkiller Hydra
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Corrosive Aura
entries: The area within 30 feet of the hydra is filled with corrosive fumes and is {@variantrule Lightly Obscured|XPHB}. A creature that starts its turn in the fumes takes 20 ({@damage 8d4}) Acid damage.

trait.name: Head Count
entries: The hydra can't make more Bite or Spit Acid attacks each round than it has heads, and each head can only be used to make one Bite or Spit Acid attack each round.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The hydra has five heads. Whenever the hydra takes 25 damage or more in a single turn, one of its heads dies. The hydra dies if all of its heads are dead.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
entries: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} that can be used only for Opportunity Attacks.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

The hydra always takes its turn on {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count 20. On its turn, the hydra can use its movement and interaction as normal. However, it does not take an action or {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the hydra takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn

legendary.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 14}, reach 20 ft. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d8 + 8}) Piercing damage.

legendary.name: Spit Acid
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 14}, range 150/600 ft. {@h}20 ({@damage 8d4}) Acid damage, and the target has the {@hazard Burning|XPHB} condition ({@dice 8d4} Acid). While {@hazard Burning|XPHB}, the target has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition.

legendary.name: Grow Heads
entries: The hydra can only perform this Epic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} if one or more of its heads died this round, unless the head was killed by Fire damage. The hydra grows two heads, and regains 20 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

legendary.name: Hydra Fury (1/Round)
entries: The hydra makes one Bite attack or one Spit Acid attack for each head that hasn't yet made an attack this round.

legendary.name: Trample (1/Round)
entries: The hydra moves up to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking Opportunity Attacks. During this movement, it can move through the spaces of Huge or smaller creatures. Each creature the hydra moves over is subjected to the following effect. {@actSave dex} {@dc 22}. {@actSaveFail} 35 ({@damage 10d6}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

legendary.name: Tail (1/Round)
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 14}, reach 15 ft. {@h}34 ({@damage 4d12 + 8}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target is pushed up to 20 feet away from the hydra.

legendary.name: Epic Resistance
entries: The hydra chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls {@dice 1d20}. On an 11+, the effect ends on it. The hydra can use this action even if it would otherwise be unable to take actions, its actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters its game statistics.

item.name: Amulet of Primal Wisdom
entries: Crafted from the dried leaves of magical plants and imbued with their dust, this amulet is decorated with a singular dried flower and then encased in sap. The pendant glows softly with the light of springtime and smells of floral fields in bloom.
Your Wisdom score is 19 while you wear this magic amulet. It has no effect on you if your Wisdom is 19 or higher without it.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating an Amulet of Primal Wisdom requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

item.name: Amulet of Incineration
entries: Crafted from a gem made from the elemental dust of an entropic flame set within a bone talisman, and glazed in the blood of an aberration, this amulet shimmers with an internal, ever-burning fire.

Once per turn, when you cast a spell that deals fire damage using a spell slot, you can choose one target that was dealt fire damage by the spell to gain the {@hazard Burning|XPHB} ({@dice 3d6} fire) condition.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating an Amulet of Incineration requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

items: [Dust] Elemental Dust from an Entropic Flame

item.name: Aqua Delerium
entries: This purple potion glows dimly with octarine light. It swirls and sparkles in its small, stoppered bottle.

When you drink this potion, you regain expended spell slots. Roll {@dice 1d6}. You choose spell slots to regain which have a combined level equal to or less than the result. None of the slots can be higher than level 5.
For one hour after drinking Aqua Delerium, roll {@dice 1d20} each time you cast a spell of level 1 or higher. On a 1, you trigger a random Arcane Anomaly.

If you consume more than one dose of Aqua Delerium before finishing a long rest, you take {@damage 1d12} necrotic damage for each spell slot level regained from the second dose, and your hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken until you finish a long rest. This damage can't be reduced or prevented in any way.
When a creature who cannot cast spells using spell slots drinks Aqua Delerium, it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage and gains one level of Contamination.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating Aqua Delerium requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

item.name: Aqua Expurgo
entries: This bright orange fluid is stored in a syringe and charged with arcane magic. You can use a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to administer the shot directly to the heart of yourself or another willing creature.

You are protected against Contamination for six hours after receiving a dose of Aqua Expurgo. During this time, whenever you fail a saving throw against an effect which would cause you to gain one or more Contamination levels, you can choose to succeed instead. You can use this ability three times, after which the effects of Aqua Expurgo expire.

If the effects of Aqua Expurgo expire in this manner, you immediately take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage and become {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute while you violently retch corrupt bile. Your hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until you finish a long rest. You die if this effect reduces your hit point maximum to 0. The necrotic damage can't be reduced or prevented by any means.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating Aqua Expurgo requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

items: [Organ] Flower from a Plant (traditionally an Eldritch Lily)

item.name: Bracers of Arc Lightning
entries: These bracers are crafted with fine leathers decorated with magical scales, washed in elemental fluids, elemental dust, and contaminated ichor. The animus used must be from a creature that deals lightning damage, allowing the bracers to channel the element.
While wearing these magic bracers you gain resistance to lightning damage and immunity to the Shocked condition.

These magic bracers have six charges, and regain all expended charges each day at dawn. Once per turn when you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack, you can expend one charge from the bracers to deal an extra {@damage 3d6} lightning damage to the target. A target which takes this damage has the Shocked condition until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating Bracers of Arc Lightning requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

items: [Animus] Animus from a creature that deals lightning damage (such as a Blue Dragon)

item.name: Charged Gauntlets
entries: These light gauntlets are made from cloth woven from the hair of a fiend and reinforced with the scales of a dragon. The gauntlets are washed with an alchemical formula made from elemental fluid and undead dust. They are then powered with a rare animus collected from an aberration.

Each time you hit with an unarmed strike while attuned to these magic gauntlets they gain one charge. The gauntlets can have up to 10 charges. Any unexpended charges disappear when you take a long rest or roll initiative.
While the gauntlets have at least one charge, your unarmed strikes deal lightning damage instead of its normal damage type.
While the gauntlets have 5 or more charges, your unarmed strikes deal an additional {@damage 2d6} lightning damage and push the target 10 feet away from you on a hit.
You can expend 2 charges from the gauntlets to cast the {@spell Shield|XPHB} spell.
You can expend 10 charges from the gauntlets to cast {@spell Destructive Wave|XPHB} or Wall of Force, using your monk's focus saving throw DC.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating Charged Gauntlets requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare Components:

items: [Hide] Scales from a Blue or Bronze Dragon

item.name: Charm of Swarms
entries: This charm resembles a large gnat. It is made of the spores of dead mushrooms; the mandibles of an insectoid creature are placed upon it. The charm is coated in an acidic bile and held together by dried mucus. It smells of bugs and rot.

When an enemy within 5 feet of you scores a critical hit on an attack made against you, you can cause the enemy to become {@hazard Burning|XPHB} ({@dice 2d6} necrotic). While the target is {@hazard Burning|XPHB} in this way, you have advantage on attacks against the target.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Charm of Swarms requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:

item.name: Circlet of Valor
entries: This steel circlet is forged from a construct and set with a gemstone animus containing a fiend. After being cleansed in the fires of a dragon's breath, this holy circlet glimmers with radiant energy.
When you cast a spell of level 1 or higher that restores hit points to a creature, that creature gains Valor ({@dice 1d4}) until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Circlet of Valor requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

item.name: Cold Snap Circlet
entries: This icy circlet is made from frozen contaminated ichor, kept in a state of permafrost by the heart of a naturally cold creature, and lined with frozen bones of undead, all powered by the animus of an elemental. Even in its permanently frozen state, it is comfortable to wear.

Once per turn, when you cast a spell that deals cold damage using a spell slot, you can choose one target that was dealt cold damage by the spell to gain the Frozen condition. The escape DC equals your spell save DC.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Cold Snap Circlet requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

items: [Organ] Heart from a White Dragon, Silver Dragon, Winter Troll, or any monster immune to cold damage

item.name: Crest of the Sacred Flame
entries: This crest is crafted from the compressed dust of fiends destroyed and sanctified by the Sacred Flame and torched in fires ignited by the elemental fluid taken from a dragon. This simple crest is made from the bones of undead creatures washed in acidic monster bile.
While attuned to this magic crest you increase the emanation of your Aura of Protection by 10 feet.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Crest of the Sacred Flame requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

item.name: Dwarven Thrower
item.reqAttune: by a dwarf or a creature attuned to a belt of dwarvenkind
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. It has {@itemProperty T|Thrown} with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. When you hit with a ranged attack using this weapon, it deals an extra {@damage 1d8} Force damage, or an extra {@damage 2d8} Force damage if the target is a Giant. Immediately after hitting or missing, the weapon flies back to your hand.

item.name: Champion's Weapon
entries: {@action Attack|XPHB} rolls made using this magic weapon can score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Champion's Weapon requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:

item.name: Blade of Retribution
entries: The metal of this blade is forged in the dust of celestials, with a hilt wrapped in fiend skin leather. The eye of a dragon is placed upon the hilt and polished in monster blood.

When you use this magic weapon to attack a creature and roll a 20 on the {@dice d20} for the attack roll, you can cast Divine Smite as part of the same action used to make the attack without expending a spell slot.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Blade of Retribution requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

item.name: Crimson Blade
entries: A blood-red ichor drips down this sword's darkened steel blade. The sword is coated in sanguine witch blood. The dust of dead vampires is forged into the steel of the blade, giving it its blackened sheen. The edge is then empowered by the heart of a dragon. Its gold hilt is wrapped in crimson leathers and a blood-red ruby plucked from the corpse of a Sanguine Witch. The fangs of vampires decorate the pommel.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic longsword.
Any creature you hit with this weapon that isn't a Construct or Undead takes an extra {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

entries.name: Curse
entries: While attuned to this blade, you can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of its occupants.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Crimson Blade requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare Components:

items: [Animus] Undead Animus from a Sanguine Witch

item.name: Dazing Hammer
entries: This hammer is made from giant bones and forged in undead dust. The bones are then stained with monster blood.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with this magic warhammer.
When you score a critical hit with this warhammer, the target is Dazed until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Dazing Hammer requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:

item.name: Electric Charge Ring
entries: This ring, composed of living lightning, is forged from elemental dust compressed into a gem around the lens eye of a construct, washed in the acidic glands of a monster before being set into an animus of an elemental.

When you cast a spell using a spell slot that deals lightning damage, choose one target that failed its first saving throw against that spell. That creature is Shocked until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating an Electric Charge Ring requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

item.name: Everhot Stew Pot
entries: This cauldron is made using the plated iron from a construct infused with the ash of an elemental. The animus used must be from a dragon which adds both control and potency to the latent elemental magics. The spoon used to stir the cauldron is carved from the bone of a magical creature. This cauldron can heat to boiling temperatures without requiring fire simply by being filled and stirred, and the stews and soups it produces are always delicious and hearty.

During a long rest, you can cook enough stew to feed up to three creatures. All creatures who eat a stew from this pot gain 10 temporary hit points. While a creature has these temporary hit points, they gain Valor ({@dice 1d4}).

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating an Everhot Stew Pot requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:

item.name: Familiar Figurine
entries: Once per day as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can use this finely carved figurine to cast {@spell Find Familiar}.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Familiar Figurine requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:

items: [Dust] Dust from an Elemental or Fey

item.name: Frozen Armor
entries: This armor channels cold energy through carefully manufactured veins of elemental fluid that run along the inside of its frame. Elemental dust is mixed with the gold in its forming, and contaminated ichor is used as a catalyst to magnify the magical effects. The animus gem placed centrally upon it must be infused with the energy of a frost giant.
While attuned to this armor you have resistance to cold damage and are immune to the Frozen condition.

This magical armor has six charges, and regains all expended charges each day at dawn. When you are hit by a melee attack, you can use your reaction and expend 1 charge from the armor to freeze your attacker in place. The creature must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be Frozen (DC 15).

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating Frozen Armor requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

item.name: Ghost Sight Bow
entries: This bow is hand-carved carefully from the bones of a dryad and stained in the undead blood of vampires. Strung with the hair of a banshee, a powerful wraith animus is placed within the handle. Once the bow's crafting is complete, it fades from its physical form into a semi-corporeal form.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic longbow.
The bow produces its own spectral ammunition which deals force damage instead of piercing damage. The ammunition disappears when it hits or misses a target.

While attuned to this weapon, you can use a bonus action to see into the Ethereal Plane and see all {@condition invisible} creatures and objects until the end of your turn. Additionally, you can see through all walls and solid objects within 60 feet of you until the end of your turn. During this time, ammunition fired from this bow passes through solid objects, and you can target enemies within 60 feet of you with your ranged attacks, even if they are behind {@quickref Cover||3||total cover}. You can use this bonus action only if you haven't moved during your turn. After you use the bonus action, your speed becomes 0 until the end of your turn.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Ghost Sight Bow requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare Components:

item.name: Giant Femur Club
entries: This club is made from the cleaned and polished femur of a giant, crafted finely into a usable two-handed club. Its tapered hilt is wrapped in stained leather. Fastened to the top of the club is a large troll skull with several monstrous teeth embedded into it like a bone morningstar, giving the weapon a grim appearance. The club is imbued with elemental power from the animus used to power the weapon, which causes it to crackle with elemental power.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic greatclub, and you have advantage on attack rolls made against Giants.
While attuned to this club you deal an additional {@damage 2d6} damage of the type associated with the elemental dust infused into it.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Giant Femur Club requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

items: [Natural Weapons] Teeth from a Giant, Beast, or Monstrosity

entries: The dust component determines the additional damage the club deals. For example, dust from a Storm Troll deals lightning damage. Eldritch Trolls cause the club to deal necrotic damage.

item.name: Gloves of Ratling Agility
entries: Your Dexterity score is 19 while you wear these ratling hide gloves. They have no effect on you if your Dexterity is 19 or higher without them.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating Gloves of Ratling Agility requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

item.name: Greater Rejuvenation Potion
entries: When you consume this potion, you immediately gain the benefits of a long rest.
Once you consume a Greater Rejuvenation Potion, you can't benefit from consuming another until you finish {@dice 3d6} long rests.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Greater Rejuvenation Potion requires a Legendary Workshop and the following Legendary Components:

item.name: Hammer of Chaos
entries: A hammer of chaos is crafted by melting down the magical plates of otherworldly constructs, infused with both the fluid and dust of elementals. The weapon is then soaked in the grey matter of an aberrant brain. This steel hammer is fitted into a shaft made from fiend skin leather and the ribs of a dragon.

You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this weapon. This hammer has {@itemProperty T|Thrown} with a normal range of 30 feet and a long range of 90 feet. When you hit with an attack using this weapon, choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder. The hammer deals {@damage 2d8} extra damage of the chosen type.

When you hit with a ranged attack using this weapon, if you roll the same number on two or more of the d8s, the hammer ricochets to a different target of your choice within 30 feet of the target. Make an attack roll against the new target, and make a new damage roll if the attack hits. After making this attack, the hammer flies back to your hand.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating the Hammer of Chaos requires a Legendary Workshop and the following Legendary Components:

item.name: Hazewind Cape
entries: This crimson and gold hooded cape is fitted with the feathers of fallen harpies and dyed in their blood, granting the wearer some resistance to the songs of harpies. The cape is then infused with the dust of a fey creature which grants it a powerful anti-charm effect powered by an animus.
While wearing this cape, you have advantage on saving throws against the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions.

entries.name: Crafting
