entries: Creating a Hazewind Cape requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:

item.name: Heart String Harp
entries: When played, this instrument reverberates with draconic whispers and enchantment that drift subtly within the notes that are struck, giving the music a sense of foreboding and palpable charm. Crafted from finely polished ivory and imbued with the animus of a fey creature, the true magic of this harp comes from the finely crafted strings made from combining the sinew of a dragon's heart chords and the hair of a fey, willingly given out of kindness.
You can use this magical harp as a spellcasting focus for your bard spells. While attuned to this item, you gain a +1 bonus to your spell attack rolls and spell save DC.
When you cast an Enchantment spell of level 1 to level 5 that targets only one creature using this harp as the spellcasting focus, you can target a second creature within the spell's range.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Heart String Harp requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

items: [Natural Weapon] Horns or Teeth of any Fey, Monstrosity, or Dragon

entries: \*At the Game Master's option, rather than being harvested from a slain fey, this hair must be willingly gifted by a fey creature.

item.name: Helm of Burning Rage
entries: This helm is forged in fires ignited with elemental dust, using plates from a construct and the heart of a red dragon. The plates are then soaked in elemental fluid before having an animus gem installed that contains the energy of a fire giant.

While your Rage is active, you gain resistance to fire damage. In addition, once per turn, while you are Raging, when you hit a target with a melee weapon that benefitted from your Reckless Attack feature, the target becomes Burning ({@dice 2d4} fire).

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Helm of Burning Rage requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

item.name: Inexhaustible Armor
entries: This armor is made from fey leathers and magical plates, infused with the chemical solutions found in some constructs and empowered with the heart of a gorgon.

While attuned to this armor, you gain an additional use of your Second Wind class feature. In addition, when you use your Second Wind, you regain an additional {@dice 3d6} hit points and can remove one of the following conditions from yourself: {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, Dazed, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, Immobilized, {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, Slowed, or Staggered.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating Inexhaustible Armor requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare Components:

item.name: Injector's Crossbow
entries: This crossbow is covered in metal plating, decorative and refined pointed metal tips along an oak wood body and foregrip. The barrel and limb are reinforced with the steel plates from a construct, with a stained leather grip made from a monster's hide. Its hair-strung bowstring and leather fasteners hold a series of syringes in place. The crossbow's stock has various tubes connecting to an alchemical chamber on the side of the weapon. A mechanical wheel feeds the darts into place upon filling them, auto-loading the crossbow for easy firing.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic crossbow. This crossbow ignores {@itemProperty LD|Loading}, and you don't need a free hand to load a piece of ammunition into it.
Once per turn when you hit a creature with a ranged attack using this crossbow, you can apply one of the following poisons:

items.name: **Virulent
items.entry: ** The target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} poison damage.

items.name: **Weakening
items.entry: ** The target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is Weakened until the start of your next turn.

items.name: **Immobilizing
items.entry: ** The target must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it is Immobilized until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating an Injector's Crossbow requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

item.name: Mantle of Otherworldly Charisma
entries: Structured from the fur and skin of a monstrosity and the horns of a fiend, and coated in the dust of fey creatures, this mantle is imbued with charming energies.
Your Charisma score is 19 while you wear this magic cape. It has no effect on you if your Charisma is 19 or higher without it.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Mantle of Otherworldly Charisma requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

item.name: Manual of Occult Anatomy
entries: Filled with diagrams showing humans with alien features, this book of strange medical lore is written in monster-blood ink infused with draconic dust and etched onto parchment pages made from aberration skin. The manuscript is bound in a scale-clad cover.

You can use this manual as a spellcasting focus for your Apothecary or Warlock spells. When you use the manual as a spellcasting focus, you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs of your Apothecary or Warlock spells. The bonus is determined by the book's rarity (see the table below).

In addition, the book contains the knowledge of an Apothecary Esoteric Theory or Warlock Eldritch Invocation up to a level determined by the manual's rarity and chosen when the item is created, which you gain while you are attuned to it. This determines which class is required to attune to the item.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Manual of Occult Anatomy requires a Workshop and Components of equal rarity to the item created. The Components required are:

item.name: Mask of Monstrous Forms
entries: This magic mask is made from the skull of a particular monstrosity (CR 6 or lower). The skull is carved into a mask, engraved with aberrant dust, and then boiled in mimic mucus, doppelganger flesh, and acidic bile. A vessel containing the animus of any creature with the Shapechanger trait is placed upon the forehead of the mask, channeling its shapechanging magic.
While attuned to the mask, you can expend two uses of your Wild Shape feature to transform into the associated monstrosity instead of a Beast.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Mask of Monstrous Forms requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

items: [Animus] Animus from a creature that has the Shapechanger trait

entries: *The Monstrosity used for this mask determines the form of the shapechange.

item.name: Monster Hunter's Weapon
entries: These weapons are carved from bark, with a core of magical sap, and decorated with leaves from magical plants. Their hilts and shafts are bound in hair from a fey creature. This magic weapon channels the natural magic found in the elements of nature.

While holding this magic weapon, you gain a bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and a bonus to spell attack rolls and save DCs of your Ranger spells (bonus by rarity). You can use it as a spellcasting focus.

When you hit with an attack using this weapon, you can expend a Ranger spell slot to cast {@spell Hunter's Mark} on the target without {@status concentration}, lasting 1 minute or until the target dies or you cast it again.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Monster Hunter's Weapon requires a Workshop and Components of rarity equal to the item's rarity:

item.name: Necromancer's Armor
entries: Constructed from bones over black woven fabric, with skull pauldrons, reinforced spine, ribcage chest piece, and beast fangs. Powered by a potent undead animus.

You are proficient with this armor even without light armor proficiency. While within 30 feet of an Undead you control, you gain resistance to all damage except radiant. Each time you take damage, an Undead you control within 30 feet takes the same amount (cannot be prevented).

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating Necromancer's Armor requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

item.name: Pelt of the Pack Lord
entries: This pelt cape is made from Garmyr fur stitched into ratling leather, decorated with harpy talons, and polished with contaminated ichor.
While attuned and within 5 feet of a hostile creature, your allies have advantage on attacks against that creature.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Pelt of the Pack Lord requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

item.name: Pendant of Prismatic Protection
entries: This jeweled pendant has 3 charges, regained on a long rest. When you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage, you can use a reaction and expend 1 charge to gain resistance to that damage type until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Pendant of Prismatic Protection requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:

items: [Fluid] Any two Elemental Fluids from different Elementals

item.name: Potion of Controlled Mutation
entries: This sickly potion contains writhing tentacles. On drinking, gain one random Mutation until a short or long rest. Roll twice on the mutation table and choose one. You gain no contamination from this.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Potion of Controlled Mutation requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:

items: [Organs] Any two Organs from an Aberration

item.name: Rat Tooth Dagger
entries: When you hit with an {@action Attack|XPHB} action using this magic dagger and apply Sneak Attack, you can make an additional attack with it as part of the same action. If that attack also qualifies for Sneak Attack, apply half your Sneak Attack dice (rounded down).

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Rat Tooth Dagger requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

item.name: Reflector Shield
entries: Formed from an Anomollusk shell with aberration leather handle, coated in contaminated ichor and set with a rare animus.
When you take acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, or thunder damage from a visible creature within 60 feet, you can use your reaction to cause that creature to take the same damage.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Reflector Shield requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

item.name: Time Dilation Medallion
entries: The inner workings of this clockwork device are formed from gears forged from magical constructs gathered around a focusing lens, held together by the needles of magical creatures. The animus used harnesses the energy of The Algorithm, a being of order and consequence, whose control over time and space ripples from the strange clockworks of the medallion.
This medallion has 3 charges. It crumbles to dust when you expend the final charge.

You can expend 1 charge from the medallion to take an extra action on your turn. Each time you do, roll {@dice 1d6}. On a 1, at the end of your turn, you become unstuck in time and space as the medallion casts the {@spell Maze} spell on you. On a 6, the medallion regains {@dice 1d3} charges.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating the Time Dilation Medallion requires a Legendary Workshop and the following Legendary Components:
*At the GM's discretion, the animus could be any other Legendary Construct instead.

item.name: Trollblood Potion
entries: This potion is a bubbling, sickly, green-brown viscous soup that has the consistency of mucus. What appears to be the rotting eye of a troll floats in the potion. It smells acrid and nauseating and tastes even worse than it looks.
When you drink this potion, for the next minute, you regain 5 Hit Points at the start of your turn. The effects end early if you take fire or acid damage.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Trollblood Potion requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

item.name: Vampire Blood Potion
entries: This potion is a crimson-red bubbling brew that tastes distinctly of copper. When you drink this potion, you gain the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: Advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Charisma attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.
If damage reduces you to 0 HP, make a Constitution saving throw (DC 5 + half damage taken, unless radiant or a critical hit). On success, drop to 1 HP instead and the potion's effects end.
The effects end early if you take radiant damage or enter sunlight.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Vampire Blood Potion requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare Components:

item.name: Wand of Jinxes
entries: This wand is carved from magical bark, with the hair of an undead creature in its core and finished in goopy ooze.
Once per turn when you deal damage with a Warlock cantrip to a creature, you can make that creature Jinxed ({@dice 1d4}) until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Wand of Jinxes requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:

item.name: Wand of the Precocious Apprentice
entries: Once per turn when you deal damage to a creature using a cantrip while holding this wand, one target of that cantrip takes an extra {@damage 1d4} damage of the same type dealt by the spell.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Wand of the Precocious Apprentice requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:

item.name: Whirling Bonesaw
entries: This large greataxe is made from a blade taken off a Ripper and refitted into a housing made from the plates of constructs and reinforced with the rib bones of a monstrosity. The blade is equipped with a leather belt that connects to an elemental-fueled motor powered by a Very Rare Animus.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
Once on your turn when you hit a Bloodied creature using this weapon, you can make one additional attack with this weapon as part of the same action.

entries.name: Crafting
entries: Creating a Whirling Bonesaw requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare Components:
